2$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/25/2019 10:02:18 PM$Reviewer: Galwaygirl, 25-34 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Been rx'd adhd meds since the 3rd grade. 20mg x 2 when I wake up. 3$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/19/2019 1:02:53 PM$Reviewer: Cambria7, 25-34 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I was first prescribed 20mg Adderall Instant Release 3x daily and had bad headaches, lower-back pain and it was only effective for about 2-3 hrs. I am so glad that I was diagnosed and I was able to start this medication The only reason that I didn't give it 5 stars for effectiveness is because I think that I should be on the next higher dose! Taking this medication has turned my life around. Before my ADD caused so many problems in my home life that my wife and I almost split up. I had a lot of problems finishing things that I started or remembering to do something because my mind would wander. Now I am able to stay on task and finish what I start. I only wish that I would have been diagnosed with this problem about 40 years ago. I wonder how it would have changed my working career?

12$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/11/2017 10:34:26 PM$Reviewer: Anthony, 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I'm 62 now and just started using Adderall at age 60. I have tried Many drugs over the years. The only thing that would help me before Adderall was Cylert. But Cylert is no longer a choice. When I first took Adderall I couldn't believe it. How I felt, how I communicated, how my attention span increased along with my focus. I just wish this drug was available to me growing up, would have made my life much easier. I take 20 mills. most days. There are some days I will not take any. Other than a little restless at night, I have had no side affects. I take no other medication and feel good now while understanding things more clearly.

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$3$5$I have been taking Adderall XR for roughly 7 years now in varying doses from 30mg to 10mg to 20mg now. My Father is a phycologist specializing in children with learning disabilities so as a child i tried several different drug (names of which i do not remember) that failed to work for me or caused too many side effects. i had been taking a 30mg dose daily for about 5 years before i decided i wanted to wain off of it so no im on a lower dose. Although i have read that there are a rather large number of side effects i have only experienced a lack in hunger and occasion difficulty to sleep (only on days when ive been late taking it). overall this drug has helped me significantly in school and general day to day life although i am concerned about the lack of knowledge in the long term use of this drug.

column1: 36$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/24/2014 12:50:17 PM$Reviewer: bohunk
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"I saw this and figured I would throw my two-cents in. There are naysayers who will question my post but
column3: I am 55 yrs old and take two Adderall 25mg caps daily. No significant increase in BP ( it went up a bit only by 3 pts ) and no heart issues except I am a couch potato ! This is a "" wonder drug "" for me since being diagnosed by 2 psychologists and a doctor on 2002. The main reason for all the professional people was my doctor making sure I was not faking Adult ADHD just to get "" speed "" for no good reason. My doctor told me there is almost a steady stream of junkies trying to hustle him for dope ( meds that are not needed ). I had to work close with my doctor to get the right dose. Look at it like a lone window on one side a garage. You want to get "" inside "" the window
column4: not before it or after it. ADHD meds no good if either or. That may explain why many parents "" freak out "" when their kid gets actually worse. Adderall may not be right for all persons. With my 49 yr old brother
column5: Ritalin works best. Hope this helps."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I am 34 years old and have ADD. I have been taking Adderall XR 30mg twice a day (60mg) since 2010. Adderall makes me focus and concentrate on tasks that I felt lazy about before. Prior to taking this medication
column3: I was unable to concentrate
column4: felt very unmotivated
column5: sluggish
column6: and was doing poor at work which inevitably made me lose my job. Since taking Adderall XR
column7: I am completing tasks on time
column8: 100% motivated
column9: I have more energy
column10: and I'm able to focus. I have also been more punctual and nothing gets left undone. However
column11: the side effects: This medication is very addictive. If you have an addictive personality
column12: do not take it. You will be dependent on it and won't be able to function without it. Sometimes when the medication wears off I get moody and irritable. It's also good to take this medication very early as it will keep you up at night. I have to take other medications to help me sleep
column13: otherwise I would be up for days
column14: which has happened. (When I don't take my sleep meds.) This medication also decreases my appetite completely. I don't ever feel like eating anything until the medication wears off
column15: and then I want to eat everything in site. I've also noticed that if you eat big meals while on Adderall
column16: it takes away the effects of it. Also
column17: I have tried other ADD medications
column18: such as: Ritalin
column19: Vyvanse
column20: and Strattera and none of them work as well for me as Adderall.

column1: 87$Condition: Other$2/18/2012 3:28:27 PM$Reviewer: Frank
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have idiopathic hypersomnia. My sleep patterns prior to this medication were severe coma like conditions
column3: it was un-telling when the next time I could ever wake up on my own. After a sleep study followed by a nap study to rule out narcolepsy
column4: my pulmonologist deemed it not narcolepsy and started me on Provigil to see if conditions improved. Soon my need exceeded the maximum dose and he switched me to Adderall XR. I now take 60mg a day before bed. Yes
column5: before bed. Taking the pills the morning didn't really work when I couldn't wake up to take them. I sleep wonderfully and after a couple years of taking this have finally established a routine sleeping schedule. I go to sleep every night at around 10-11pm and wake up at 6am every morning WITHOUT an alarm clock.

column1: Since taking this pill
column2: I've benefited nicely by some of it's other side effects mostly relating to learning capacity. I've never been one for reading
column3: mostly because I'd fall asleep
column4: but now
column5: I'll read through an interesting text book like it was a novel.

column1: A side effect I wish I had was decreased appetite and weight loss. Since this pill
column2: I have gained 40-50lbs. Probably because I spend most of my spare time advancing in non-physical activities. If only a mental workout burned more calories.

column1: Some really bad side effects include withdrawals. DO NOT stop taking this pill before speaking to MD. Imagine how bad you were before and double it; if you didn't have depression before
column2: you will. Because this Med is a Class 2 in the US
column3: it is highly controlled
column4: very hard to refill and not run out. Talk to your MD about a backup MD when that one is out. There are no refills
column5: you must have original signature (no faxing)
column6: maximum is 30 days per RX
column7: and they can only release the RX one week prior to running out. Keep in mind any insurance authorizations as well."

97$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/6/2011 5:55:31 PM$Reviewer: theADHDmomME, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$3$5$When I first started taking Adderall XR (10mg) it was like I got my life back. I was just recently diagnosed with severe ADHD, moderate depression, and mild anxiety. I have known that something wasn't right with me since I was very little but I have parents who were in denial and too afraid of stigmas and what other ppl think about them to have had any help until now. With Adderall so far I have noticed that altho it definitely helps my concentration/focus/motivation it causes me to hyperfocus (act OCD) about certain things, my anxiety is worse, and I get mean and brutally/cruelly honest with those around me at times. I've also noticed that I talk to myself more often (which I've always done to a certain extent; like when I'm frustrated, doing math, or figuring something out)but now is more noticeable. I also have very bad dry mouth, an unquenchable thirst, and chapped lips. I can't go anywhere without a bottle of water and chapstick now. Otherwise, the sleep problems and loss of appetite went away after the first 3 days. Right now I'm in the 'deciding' phase trying to figure out if the benefits outweigh the side effects. I know that I have to continue some sort of medication along with my cognitive behavioural therapy because I can't function at normal expectations at this point otherwise but I'm uncomfortable with some of the possible side effects and the idea of becoming dependant. I have a history of street drug use(I self-medicated as a teen/young adult) and altho I have been clean for years I am always very careful and afraid of becoming that person again. Up until recently, I had only heard positive things about Adderall but now I'm not so sure. I guess I will finish off this month, talk to my psych more about it, and then go from there...

column1: 121$Condition: Other$7/8/2011 5:21:48 PM$Reviewer: TomSawyer
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years$5$5$5$"I have been on this medication for 3 years now and it has changed my life. I like many others here hated myself because I felt lazy I struggled in school to make average grades. In my short college stint one of my professors pulled me aside told me he had pulled my file and wondered why I did so badly in his course because my test scores were so high. I have been successful but it was a long hard struggle. My wife of 32 years is a retired special education teacher. About four years ago she told me that she didn't know why it never dawned on her but she felt I was ADD. I am not hyper but have always had trouble staying focused. In school I use to fight the urge to look out the window and I couldn't concentrate. I went to my doctor and was tested he felt this medication would help me. Boy was he right! I makes me wonder where I might be if this could have been diagnosed when I was a child and there would have been treatment for it. At that time I was considered lazy and treatment was staying in at recess and having to write ""lines"". I still struggle with time management and the urge to be sidetracked but I am improving on both accounts."

column1: 122$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/6/2011 1:08:24 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been on Adderall XR since it first came out.  I have been taking meds for ADHD for 28 yrs now.  I like Adderall XR because it lasted longer than the Ritalin
column2: therefore I didn't have the up down up down feeling.  Adderall is a smoother transition too.  Of course it is not a cure all.  I still watch what I eat
column3: work on time management
column4: and do the occasional talk therapy.  I have also been the subject of multiple studies on ADHD since I was ""raised on Ritalin"" here it what I learned.  I am more prone to Alcoholism
column5: I am more prone to ""falling in love""
column6: I am more prone to acting out my anger.  Actions and feelings are easy impulses but my ADHD is not an excuse.  My mind understands
column7: what has been so hard is to delay the impulse whether I am on medication or on a medication vacation.  I take 30mg of Adderall XR in the morning
column8: 30 mg of ritalin in the afternoon
column9: 80 mg of Straterra
column10: and 300mg of Wellbutrin.  All this Medication in one day so I take med vacations in order to lower my tolerance.  Funny thing is I am only diagnosed with ADHD.  Believe me Doctors have tried to find some other condition bc ADHD usually is combined with ""something else"" but I am a classic ADHD case.  Getting meds for ADHD is easy now adays what is hard is taking responsibility for your treatment after your diagnosis.  I quit drinking
column11: have taken the anger and time management classes
column12: and married a man I respected.  I also don't use my ADHD as an excuse in my professional life
column13: my employeers don't need to know my personal life.  Finally Yoga has had a great affect on my ability to focus
column14: HUGE.  I hope the people who are ADHD make it clear to their Doctors that the H means hyperactive NOT manic.  I have experienced too many non ADHD doctors who are ready to label and prescribe the newest ""condition"".  I don't have much respect for the medical communities understanding of ADHD.  All I know is that the medication is only one part of the equation
column15: its the easy part.  Good luck i hope i helped."

column1: 126$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/29/2011 11:28:10 AM$Reviewer: trailrider
column2: 45-54 Male  (Patient) $4$4$5$I've probably lived my entire 49 yrs with undiagnosed ADD
column3: but over years of building defense mechanisms to compensate
column4: it evolves into issues that don't fit the traditionally accepted symptoms. I was never hyperactive
column5: don't currently have difficulty reading or focusing on specific tasks. I do however
column6: tend to hyperfocus
column7: don't like interruption and don't transition very easily. I also don't like a lot of activity and noise as that affects my ability to focus. At times
column8: my mind is being barraged with a bunch of external and internal stimuli. It becomes too much and I will get irritable and react negatively to my family. It's not the way I feel inside
column9: but it's all right on the surface trying to defend my focus. It has evolved into a degree of anxiety and depression about the inability to soften the impact of stimuli. I was starting to get more and more down
column10: more withdrawn
column11: and dark. I tried some of the anxiety/depression medication like Zoloft (a year and a half)
column12: but I felt more anxiety from them. I am not sure the Zoloft ever worked for me at all. I finally decided one day to try my daughter's Adderal (she also has ADD). The difference was significant. 80% of the negative stimuli dissipated and was replaced with positive feelings... confidence
column13: patience
column14: peace. Everything became more manageable and I felt a lot more normal. So after a couple months on Adderal XR25
column15: it is working pretty well... not perfect
column16: but a lot better. I also tried Focalin and was initially prescribed Vyvanse. The Vyvanse laid too heavy on me and I felt out-of-body. The Focalin was better
column17: but the Adderal XR25 seemed the best fit. For adults
column18: symptoms and issues around ADHD don't fit the traditional. The psych said adult ADHD is in the process of being redefined by the medical community.

139$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/15/2011 4:57:31 PM$Reviewer: Cubclubber17, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$2$3$Very good medication for keeping focused for patients with ADD or ADHD. I had adult ADHD so my mind would try to focus on multiple things at once and it would overload. For the first few months the medication was great.
The last year and half has gone from good times to a living hell. I upped my dose from 20 mg to 20 mg and 15 mg in the afternoon. That is when the living hell began.

It made me feel like the world around me didn't matter. The only two things I cared about were my grades and my girlfriend. Everything else was non existent in my mind. I started losing friends left and right
column2: I became a lot less sociable
column3: and my parents knew something was up. When my only other friends I had told me what they noticed
column4: the medication made me not believe them and I then became very paranoid.

column1: I thought everyone around me was an enemy looking to make my life miserable someway or another. My anxiety levels skyrocketed and I always had my head on a swivel. It was a terrible way to live life. I even started thinking my girlfriend was up to no good when she wasn't around me so I started becoming clingy to her.

Thank God I stopped taking this medication. I found self worth in myself again and I my ex friends became friends with me again. Everyone in my life noticed a great difference and that's when I realized I needed to stop taking this medication.
My advice
column2: ""DON'T TAKE THIS MEDICATION UNLESS YOUR ADD/ADHD IS RUINING YOUR LIFE."" And if you have to use this medication
column3: make sure you use it only on the days you need to concentrate. Your life can spin out of control if you take this medication for an extended amount of time in my experience."

column9: no more than that. It doesn't make me speedy or irritable. It doesn't kill my appetite. What it does do
column10: is help me get out of bed in the morning and want to do things I procrastinate on. It helps my short term memory and I stay on task. I take it in the morning and excersise later at night
column11: so my heart rate isn't up too high before working out. I really haven't had problems with this medication and I can go without taking it
column12: I don't feel a dependency on it. This is my own experience taking this
column13: and I know everybody has different reactions to medication. It's helped to rid the effects of my antidepressants which make me tired
column14: apathetic and sleepy. I don't advocate taking medication for any purpose besides helping to let a person participate in their life to the fullest
column15: and this has helped me do just that. "

column1: 215$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/21/2010 11:28:50 AM$Reviewer: Snips
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have to agree with everyone that reccommends Adderall. It has changed my life
column3: although I understand that everyone is different and reacts to everything very differently. You have to take that into consideration when reading these reviews.

column1: I always felt like there was something not right with me until my Phyc. suggested the Adderall. First I was put on a  Regular Dose of 10mg in the morning and a 10mg in the afternoon (which I hated cus I'm terrible at taking my pills)
column2: so we switched to 20mgXR. Things has changed drasticly. I can focus
column3: Im not chronicly late anymore
column4: which then disposes of my road rage. My work is off the charts (Im a hairstylist)
column5: because I can really focus and listen to my clients. Before I always had a million things running through my head and couldnt get my shit together. I obvioulsy have more energy
column6: and I do have to say that my anxiety and depression have lessened. I think eveyone gets anxious
column7: its just a part of life
column8: it doesnt mean you have something wrong with you.

column1: So side effects
column2: signifigant weight loss
column3: 12lbs since November
column4: Im not complaining. I do have loss of appitite during the day and def am hungry when I get home. I notice my mouth is always dry. But I have no problem getting to bed. And I really don't have dependency issues
column5: some times on Sundays I don't even take it.

column1: So that's that
column2: It works for me
column3: may not work for you. But you have to try things to know how you'll react!"

column1: 225$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/12/2010 1:15:34 PM$Reviewer: yael
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$1$5$"I have been taking Adderall XR
column3: 50mg/day (30 in the morning
column4: 20 in the afternoon) for about four years.  Before that
column5: I took Dexedrine.  With the exception of ages 18-21
column6: I took some form of stimulant since age 13.

column1: Adderall is highly addictive.  I feel it has ruined my life.  I loved the euphoric feeling and weight loss side effects
column2: but it was so addictive I broke down and took it during my last trimester of pregnancy and now I fret it has caused a disproportionately small head size in my11-week-old daughter.  (weight and length are off the charts but head is only 50th percentile
column3: and was only 25th percentile at birth)

column1: It was also so addictive I quit breastfeeding at 5 weeks to go back on the meds.
Now it's causing dry mouth to the point of receding gums and ruining my teeth
column2: and I'm still considering going back on it.  (when I realized the affect it was having on my dental health -- I quit taking it
column3: and that was 2 days ago.  The fatigue from the withdrawal is crushing.)

column1: I wish my parents had never started me on these meds.
Please
column2: parents
column3: do not start your kids on these meds.  Their ADD can be an asset -- there are different perceptions of this 'disorder'.  They are better at multitasking and can hyperfocus when they are truly passionate about something...

column1: The drugs are a gateway to a nightmare.
There is no magic bullet."
226$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/11/2010 8:49:30 PM$Reviewer: $3$4$4$
227$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/10/2010 10:24:42 AM$Reviewer: spofford
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $1$1$5$"Some practical advice: 1) be rigorously honest with yourself as to whether you have a TRUE
column3: objective diagnosis of ADHD! 2) heed the warnings about using this drug is you have ANY issue with addictive behavior.

column1: I probably do have ADHD but I am convinced that my use of Add over 2 years contributed to my life spinning out of control. I became impulsive
column2: sometimes agressive
column3: etc; started drinking excessively to ""come down""
column4: mind was moving too fast to deal with life issues. Be wary of statement on this website that benefits should outweigh side effects! For me
column5: it was great for a while but wow
column6: did it help me mask life and land in a ditch (literally as during one episode I totalled my vehicle). Remember that the generic name is ""amphetamine"" and this is
column7: for me
column8: just a nicely packaged pharmaceutical called ""speed"". I'm now dealing with life on life's terms; not perfect
column9: but drug free and I pray I never go back!  Again
column10: rigorous honesty!"

column1: 228$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/9/2010 7:08:58 PM$Reviewer: Tamara

column3: but noticed some hysteria in getting a blood test done (after 3 attempts

column5: she really cycles out of control.  We just had our last and final episode of the med...she totaly ""wigged out""....worse than the previous hysteria...all about cleaning her room.  It took my husband and me 45 min to calm her down.  She was mentally and physically exhausted.  We were terrified by what we witnessed.  She's only been off the med since Sat.
column6: but so far she's feeling better.  I'm scard to try something else

column8: including death.  Unfortunately
column9: this didn't warrant its removal from the US market and I only learned about this AFTER the troubles my daughter went through."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$1$5$"I wish I could give this drug 0 stars for satisfaction.  I have been taking Adderall XR for over 3 years.  I am now considering changing to a different ADHD med.  Here's why:

column1: When I filled my prescription for DAW (dispense as written) name brand Adderall XR
column2: the pharmacist showed me that all the pills in the name brand bottle were all imprinted with M. Amphet. Salts - just like the generic. She even opened a new bottle
column3: to show me that Walgreens wasn't trying to screw me over.

column1: I called Shire and they said that the FDA approved Shire imprinting the name brand capsules with either ADERALL XR or M. Amphet. Salts and that as long as my prescription came from a name brand bottle that said ""Shire"" that I was taking the same name brand drug I've been taking all along.
I HIGHLY doubt what I've been taking for the past few days is regular name brand Aderall XR. I have been experiencing headaches
column2: as well as
column3: tight/clenched upper back muscles
column4: tingling/numbness in my face and pressure behind my eyes. I also feel like I'm on something - I never felt like I was on something when I took name brand Adderall XR before!

column1: I called Shire again and again they told me that as long as my prescription came from a bottle that said ""Shire"" that I was taking the same name brand drug.  Shire is lying."

241$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/7/2010 1:36:11 PM$Reviewer: Happy Camper
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$4$Finding Adderall XR has been like divine intervention for me. I have severe ADHD that runs in my family. My brother has ADD and my sister has hyperactivity without the inattentiveness that she finds highly adaptive. My nephew (brother's son) took Adderall with great results for many years. Although I have had a lifelong history of ADHD (and was in special ed) I had always been misdiagnosed. I won't even go into the crazy things I was labelled with. Despite such a grim prognosis I was able to complete grad school with a 4.0 average at USC and obtain a professional license in health care. When I tried to obtain meds for ADHD this was used against me and I was told that I could not be this successful with severe ADHD and was even labelled bi-polar by the chief of neurology due to my hyperactivity which has become worse when I turned 50. Finally a colleague prescribed Strattera which not only made my sick it also gave me nightmares. Next was Concerta which worked great but gave me such severe dry mouth that it destroyed my mucous membranes. Recently I switched to Adderal. By this time I was saying my prayers. It works great! I had mild dry mouth that was self-limiting and am on top of my game. The best thing is the improve social skills due to < impulsivity and the improved concentration. I am a new woman! Thank you shire. I take 20 mg QAM and 10 mg in the afternoon. It also decreases my PTSD symptoms. From reading the posts my experience appears unusual and I hope it encourages adults.

column1: 242$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/5/2010 2:34:10 PM$Reviewer: john doe
column2: Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I've tried Vyvanse
column3: Strattera and concerta for my ADHD.  Adderall XR is the best hands down.  Strattera didn't work at all and the concerta was ok but didn't last 12 hours like it's supposed to
column4: plus my liver enzymes tested high on it.  Vyvanse gave the worse sides.  My eyes were always bloodshot and I was always paranoid.  I feel at ease and can focus and concentrate for long periods of time at school and work.  For people that legitmitally have ADD/ADHD like me
column5: this drug works wonders
column6: provided that you take it properly and DO NOT crush the beads and snort it or inject it.  It is meant to be taken orally and create and acheive a steady baseline level so there aren't as many highs and lows throughout the day.  One side effect I have found out to be negative is that it takes me 2 hours to fall asleep at night.  Aside from that
column7: I now live a normal life and excel in both school and work.

column1: 243$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/4/2010 12:17:37 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was diagnosed with ADHD when I was in 3rd grade.  I really did affect me through out my elementary

I soon realized in high school that my disorder wasn't all that bad and that being different is being beautiful.  I started Adderall when i was in 9th grade I believe and it changed my life for the better immediately
column3: it helped me focus
column4: be a better person
column5: and not completely annoy people =]. This pill truly saved my academic life and my personal life as well.  Thank you to whoever invented Adderall and I recommend it to all who has ADHD.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$5$I was not prescribed Adderall for ADD or ADHD. I am taking several medications that make me very tired and lethargic
column3: have gained weight easily and often feel as though I never slept at night. My psychiatrist told me that people who work night shift or other than day schedules sometimes benefit from Adderall. I was prescribed 10mg 3X/day but rarely take that much. In fact

The only side effect I notice is a headache in the late afternoon. I am careful to refrain from taking it too close to bedtime
column6: or I won't be able to sleep. I didn't know and did not experience the appetite suppressant effect. Maybe that only works with higher doses than I'm taking. Thanks to everyone who wrote in. It really helps to  read about other people's experiences .

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$4$"I am 25 and have been on Adderall XR since I was 14. Adderall has worked very well for me. Some of the benefits for me are increased focus
column3: ability to effectively process information and form and express coherent thoughts more effectively. When I am on my medicine
column4: I find it easier to complete tasks
column5: whereas without the medication
column6: completing even the easiest of tasks (like unpacking groceries) is difficult because I get sidetracked. When I am not on my medicine I tend to exhibit a lot of impulsive behaviors
column7: but on my medicine
column8: I am better able to think before I act
column9: so to speak. Another benefit is that I am not bored as frequently. One obvious negative side effect is loss of appetite. I lost a lot of weight in the first year or so of being on Adderall. I could easily go for a day without eating. I just didn't look healthy. Some of my family members and teachers thought I had become anorexic and were getting worried. After I graduated college
column10: I went off Adderall for about a year and hated it. I gained back the weight I had lost plus more because of nervous/bored eating
column11: and I struggled in school (in my masters program)
column12: at work
column13: and some of my relationships with others suffered. I have been back on Adderall XR for about 3 months now and am much happier with life in general. I just feel more balanced and in control of myself
column14: which is nice. I have noticed decreased appetite
column15: but to a MUCH lesser extent than in high school and college. Some of the negative side effects I have always experienced while on the drug are decreased sex drive (although that has improved)
column16: dry mouth
column17: and what I call ""hyper-focus"" - the inability to switch from one task to another. The effectiveness of AdderallXR obviously varies from person to person
column18: as do the positive and negative side effects. THough I have had some negative side effects
column19: my overall experience with AdderallXR has been VERY positive."

column1: 312$Condition: Other$9/25/2009 2:35:34 AM$Reviewer: narcolepsyslife
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$2$5$"History: I have had the symptoms of narcolepsy since childhood. First memories I can recall is around 5 years of age.

column1: I did not get it officially diagnosed until I was 50 years old.  I knew the stigma of Narcolepsy would interfere with job searching.
My new Neurologist is a sleep studies specialist. He is aware on how ineffective the Amphetamines react within me. No side effects
column2: slight increase in heart rate and slight rise on the BP. No burst of energy or any other effects.  I am now on a base prescription of adderall and adderall XR combination at 160mg per day. At times the ranges may go as far up to 240mg or down to only several.  The amount of the dosage is directly dependent of the dayâs requirements.  I also try to take 1-2 days of Adderall free days to lessen the problem of drug tolerance.  The adderall still at the high dose performs very poorly in managing my microsleeps. I can take a full dose
column3: wait 45 minutes
column4: then lie down and fall asleep. I am also on Xyrem treatments for the last 5 months.  Xyrem is not working very well.  I have been diagnosed as a right clinical context narcolepsy.  I unfortunately am one of the exceptions to the effectiveness of amphetamines and the like. Even from the beginning
column5: the amphetamines have had little effect on my body. History:  I was never a drug user and I never liked to drink alcohol. I still don't drink or use recreational drugs.  Never had any of the 'so called side effects' that amphetamines can give someone at the higher dose. In the past I have had provigil and ritlan with no effective treatment. If the above appears to be disassociated
column6: I had more than several microsleep episodes trying to get this written.

column1:
313$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/25/2009 12:32:05 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$5$3$I have been taking this medication as long as I can remember. As far as my ADD is concerned, it works wonders. However, I get extremely fixated while doing things (such as browsing the web and cleaning) and will often do them for over 5 hours without stopping. It has caused me anxiety, a misdiagnosis of a heart mutation due to my high heart-rate (caused by the medication), teeth grinding, and frequent sleep problems. Also, the withdrawal symptoms are very severe and I often can not even stay awake during the day if I do not take it. Overall, the benefits do outweigh the side effects and I feel that I will be continuing to take this medication for a very long time.

328$Condition: Other$8/22/2009 7:37:31 AM$Reviewer: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$3$1$"I was prescribed this medication to balance out extremes in anxiety

column1: While taking this medication for five months

column1: 348$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/15/2009 3:01:53 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$5$"I am 22 and have always had problems in school & life in general. I've had trouble with listening
column2: paying attention to detail
column3: getting things done
column4: anxiety
column5: stress
column6: eating disorders etc etc the list goes on. I come from a family who cares for me tremendously so it has nothing to do with them..So
column7: before I started taking this it was hard for me to even get out of bed in the morning & carryout my day. I was diagnosed with bulimia/nervosa & depression so I take a combination of Prozac & Adderall and it has changed my life 100% and for the better. I wake up with energy
column8: take on the day
column9: I dont binge eat nor vommit because with the adderall suppressing my apetite I do not get the urge to eat when im bored. However
column10: it is easy to maintain a healthy diet and eating regularly. For the first time I am making A's in my classes
column11: which NEVER happened in highschool & I enjoy life so much more. The thing I really had to get used to was harnessing my energy. I would start a ""project"" and not want to finish it until I was done but i would really need to do homework or something of greater importance. I had to train myself to prioritize and make schedules
column12: something that comes so easily to others. But
column13: once I re-trained my brain how to function to be successful it really helped me get through life. Like I said
column14: I'm finally making good grades AND getting to class (and everywhere else) on time. I'm not sure if I reccommend adderall to kids under the age of 15 unless theyre morally responsible but I definitely recommend it to young-adults & so on."

column1: 351$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/10/2009 10:44:01 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Adderall XR is a very effective treatment for ADHD.  It helps concentration all day.  In my experience
column2: it should not be taken after 11:00 am because it may cause insomnia.  This medicine also decreases appetite
column3: which could be a good or bad thing
column4: depending on the patient.  I am not overweight
column5: so the appetite supression became a slight problem for a while
column6: but the positive effects outweighed the negative effects by far.  Once I had been taking it for a while
column7: I was able to eat normally again
column8: but people who are under-weight should be monitored in order to make sure they are eating enough.  Another thing about this medication is that it is very addictive.  It has been effective for me for the past 4 years
column9: but I am unable to function normally without it.  People who are prescribed Adderall XR should be aware that they may become dependent
column10: and if they are to discontinue taking it
column11: they should definitely taper their dosage down fairly slowly.  Overall
column12: Adderall XR has been an incredible improvement for my concentration.  I believe
column13: however
column14: that it should not be administered to young children because of it's strong effects.  If it is needed for a child
column15: they should take the lowest effective dose.

column1: 352$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/8/2009 1:00:45 PM$Reviewer: MoKs13
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$5$"I was diagnosed with ADHD in 3rd grade when I started taking ritalin. The medication gave me ""ticks"" and terribled anxiety. I was off med treatment for adhd by the time i was 14. I managed to get through highschool and 2 years of college despite the trouble and chaos i got myself into. about a year ago i started taking adderall for my ADHD again. the first 8 months were great. my racing thoughts became more organized and i was able to prioritize my tasks in order to complete them. If you look at other posts listed here the users of 1-6 mo will have more positive feedback than those of long term. its been about a year and im trying to get myself off of this. i have started to experience withdrawal symptoms in the morning and evening. theyre terrible. i could avoid these symptoms by upping my dose but ultimatly that would be masking rather than solving. which is what so many people do. the drug is seriously effective for adhd but i would warn on dose amounts to be sure your not masking harmful dependency signs or the outcome in the longrun will be way worse than any adhd symptoms you thought were bad."

362$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/10/2009 9:46:42 PM$Reviewer: KristaG, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$1$1$The medication did its job, but the side effects were to strong for me. I had bad mood swings. I was dizzy all of the time. I was so tired, but I could not sleep. Eating made me feel like I was going to throw up. I was keeping my room clean and doing everything I was supposed to do because of the medication. I was more focused and serious about things, but I lost friends. I was no longer myself anymore. It took everything people loved about me away. I recomend to think before you use this drug and to be careful if you have important things coming up. The side effects totally changed who I was and what I could do. The friends I told about this were the ones that helped me when they started to notice things and that helped. When I finally stopped it took awhile for me to fully lose the side effects. Keep up with your side effects and make sure you think is it better for me to stop or keep going. In my case the bad totally wiped out the good.

366$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/3/2009 11:04:55 PM$Reviewer: figrditout, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking Adderall since last November (08). I was started on 20mg of Adderall xr
column2: then went to 25 mg xr
column3: and now I take 25mg xr in the morning around 6am
column4: and then an Adderall IR
column5: 10mg
column6: around noon to one p.m. I think Adderall works great
column7: the problem I had was that even though it is an XR formulation it seemed to wear off around noonish everyday. I was never able to get ""all day coverage"". In February my doctor added the 10mg IR ""booster"" and it has worked great ever since. He told me that every one's body metabolism is different and some get longer coverage than others. This is what worked for me. I was worried about sleep issues being on this dose
column8: the amazing thing is I actually feel like I sleep better since being on this medication. When I lay down to go to sleep I don't have a million and one things floating through my head like I use to. It's like the background ""white noise"" is gone. My thoughts are so much clearer now and I can actually get things accomplished instead of 20 things half accomplished. It's too bad people abuse this drug
column9: it's makes it more difficult for people who use it for legitimate medical purposes to get it. All of my other medications I can get a 90 day supply in the mail. With Adderall I have to go to my doctors office every month and pick up my prescription in person. Other than that absolutely no complaints. Good luck to all."

column1: 376$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/12/2009 5:38:43 PM$Reviewer: MOM OF 5 !!

column10: hollaring

column1: 380$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/6/2009 12:51:27 AM$Reviewer: Mezmoin Mobz
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$"Ok to start off I have known for sometime that I have had ADHD but when i was younger I didn't think much of it
column3: and my parent wasn't all for drugging up the kids
column4: Now right now my doctor has put me on the 15mg XR capsule
column5: and to tell ya the truth
column6: I haven't experienced too many side effects
column7: i mean I have had the loss of apatite and insomnia sometimes but the insomnia is because i take it around 11am and I am a night owl to begin with. As for the loss of apatite I just decided to get more carbs protein all the calories etc
column8: more in just a 1-2 meal's a day instead of having 3-4 ( yes i love to eat and I am a cook) But for the most part the loss of apatite will dissapate once i get myself
column9: used to the medicine.

column1: Now as for how it helps me out has been great
column2: I have alot more focus
column3: I don't feel that my mind is running around at 1000mps in 800 different directions. I also get that euphoric feeling of happiness
column4: and sometimes catch myself spacing out to the clouds sometimes
column5: or just good enjoyable moments that i prolly couldn't stop myself to see.

column1: Overall I enjoy this medication
column2: sometimes yes i get mad that i only get 4-6 hours of sleep but I am learning to manage my sleeping times to were it cycles just right
column3: and now that i have been on it for about 10 days i am starting to actually sleep 1-2 hours more a night as long as knowbody calls me or etc. (before i was a heavy sleeper now I can't even take naps :( i will miss you naps.) but now i dont have to string my alarm clock across the room to force me out of bed and to turn it off etc cause before i would just sleep through it"

column1: 381$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/4/2009 10:24:56 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$4$I had absolutely NO idea I had ADHD until after I graduated from High School. I could always get myself into trouble because I couldn't focus in class or I just got borred. I was always tired. After I started taking Adderall I started noticing a difference right away; I was a whole new person. I have been on 50mg a day for about 4-5 years now and I don't know what I would do without it. I can focus
column2: finish everything I start
column3: I have more energy. In the first year of taking Adderall I did loose a significant amount of weight
column4: but for me...my appitite came back. I gained all that weight back and have no problems eating meals on a regular schedule. Not to worry.

column1: 382$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/2/2009 3:44:05 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$"I was diagnosed with ADHD as a child but my parents chose nonpharmalogical methods to deal with it then. I made it through school but was always reprimanded for being a procrastinator or being too social. After passing my nursing boards and having a job that required responsibilty
column2: so to speak
column3: I talked to my docotr and she was amazed that I had made it this far in life with the severity of my symptoms.  I have been on Adderall 30mgBID (twice a day) and can not believe the difference.  I am a full time student and work full time nights also
column4: I have total ability to complete everything as needed. I no longer procrastinate on anything and feel so much more organized.  I have had about 20 lbs weightloss so I am 5'2"" and 107 which doesn't look so healthy. another side affect that I experince is the ability to sleep forever when I don't take it.  I have no problems sleeping at night on the days I take it but its nothing for my husband to come and wake me up and it be 2pm :(! I have also found that having gum on hand at all times helps with the dry mouth.  I have a question for anyone taking adderall XR... do you pay attention to foods with citric or asorbic acid because these have been said to decrease the effect and speed up the breakdown of adderall???? I have found a lot of nothing on this subject."

column1: 384$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/25/2009 11:43:44 PM$Reviewer: Cyberknite
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$5$"I have Adult ADHD type 2 subclass D - the ""Day Dreamer"".  I personally refer to it as Theta World.  Just east of Narcolepsy and due south of ADHD type 1.

column1: Adderall XR has worked well to fill a void that was missing in my quest for balance.  It provides a ""kick""
column2: of sorts
column3: to the mind and body.  I find it spurs mental motivation
column4: which in turn
column5: the body responds to quite well.  I take 1 in the a.m and 1 in the mid afternoon.  This seems to get me through to the early evening. Note:  There is some irrability experienced
column6: in my case
column7: as the dosage fades.  Foretunately
column8: I discovered Strattera long before adding Adderall XL
column9: which actually works very well as a counter measure.(Read my review on Strattera).  Although
column10: I should add that Adderall XL does not have the crash that I experienced on some of the more popular ""stimulated"" drugs.  Nor do I feel a ""pull"" of dependency.

column1: That being said
column2: I did inadvertently take a short ""Holiday"" from the drug
column3: and noted  a definite drop in mood towards depression accompanied by an increased lethargic feeling. A withdrawl effect. Not dire
column4: but to be noted
column5: nonetheless.

column1: 393$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/9/2009 3:06:30 AM$Reviewer: Worksforme
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$4$"33/F i started taking Adderall Xr 40mg's a day 3 years ago. Increased my ability to focus on important details
column3: caused a 25lbs weight loss in 6 weeks..I looked anorexic because I'm tall and slender as it is.  If I drink coffee during the day I'm like a crackhead - very antisocial
column4: nervous
column5: won't answer the door phone etc
column6: lose track of time
column7: and crazy OCD.  So I cut down on the coffee and that's working.  I also take ""drug holidays""  just to make sure I don't ""need it"".  When I want energy and need to focus I take it..otherwise
column8: I leave it. I also experience mood swings and my muscles tighten up
column9: so I get buns of steele without the exercise.  I have the best career in the world and taking adderall makes me even better at it.  Be smart
column10: take it properly and pay attention to the side effects and you'll be alright.  I worry about children taking it because they need to be social and be accepted by their peers
column11: and it's tough if you lack personality.  So three years for me and I'm in control of it and happy.  Oh..and when I take the drug holiday
column12: I don't get withdrawals..just more tired than usual for the first several days.  Take Vitamin B for that."

column1: 403$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/25/2009 4:31:16 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$4$"I have a job with crazy hours and I just could not keep up. I never had the hyper part it was more scattered

column3: however

405$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/19/2009 3:06:02 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$I have been taking 25mg of Adderall XR for almost 3 months now. I have to say I've had a pleasent experience with this. I am in Nursing school, so the Adderall gives me that extra push I need. I feel like I constantly need to be studying, I listen & take better notes in class, and my grades have got better. I am also able to study for longer periods of time because I have more energy & can stay up later. However, I have had some pretty drastic side effects. I occasionally have dry mouth, but my anxiety & stress seems to be 10000 times worse, I seem to make situations alot worse than they actually are. I am ALOT more irratible & don't have much patience. It has made me very blunt, so I hope noone makes me mad. & my finger has got to where it twitches but other than that.... & on the days I don't take it, i'm so tired, I can hardly keep my eyes open but i'm in a happier mood, just too tired to do anything. So for the most part, my exp. with Adderall has been good. ALOTTT better than Methyphenidate (wayyyy ti many SE!) which I was taking prior to the Adderall XR.

column1: 455$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/11/2009 4:31:47 PM$Reviewer: livinggood
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been on Adderall xr 25mg for about 3 months now.  I'm 6'2"" tall and weigh 200lbs.  I can easily sum up Adderall xr by saying WOW!!  I used to be very very anti anything ADD/ADHD
column3: I use to think it was a way for the pharmaceutical companies to ""push more drugs"" on us.  What changed my thinking was when my son was having a lot of trouble with school work and was diagnosed with ADHD.  I saw the exact same symptoms in him that I had when I was young.  I have always had trouble in school.  It wasn't that I wasn't interested I just couldn't stay focused long enough to get into the material.  I went and spoke with my family doctor
column4: told him the situation
column5: the symptoms I was having
column6: my past school performance
column7: current job performance
column8: etc... and he decided to prescribe me Adderall xr 25mg.  Another thing he told me to do was to cut out ALL caffeine
column9: which I did.  The first three days I popped Ibuprofen all the time because of caffeine withdrawal headaches but after that the transformation has been wonderful.  I have had anxiety problems with mild depression for as long as I can remember
column10: actually anxiety runs on my side of the family.  Starting the first day with Adderall I could tell a big difference.  I had that euphoria that everyone writes about but my thinking
column11: concentration
column12: my ability to prioritize
column13: and get things done has been AMAZING.  Now that I have been on the med for a little over 3 months the euphoria feeling is gone
column14: that was gone in the first few days of use
column15: but my ability to stay focused
column16: concentrate
column17: prioritize
column18: and basically ""get er done"" has been excellent
column19: actually after a month of being on the med it seemed like it improved somewhat again
column20: I actually find myself speaking slower and more methodically.  I couldn't be happier.  I actually think that A LOT of my anxiety and mild depression have been related to my NOT being diagnosed with ADD sooner in my life.  Since starting this med I actually feel like a different person. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED."

column1: 456$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/11/2009 1:21:54 PM$Reviewer: Skippy
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I have suffered for many years with jobs
column3: relationships and finances. I finally took a proactive approach to my life and decided to get tested (observed). Come to find out i have ADHD. Most of my friends said they knew i already had it but it was not that apparent to me. The diagnosing doctor told me my life would improve drastically to the medication and what it has to offer. Well
column4: within months of starting the medication my employer created a new position for me as i was finally able to focus. My finances are getting back on track (paying stuff off instead of frivolous spending). Relationship i am working on but i am finally more focused on taking my career even further. I wish i would have taken this approach earlier in my life. I am now 33 and finally living my life the way i want. I used to sleep terrible
column5: now i actually have no issues falling asleep (most of the time anyway). My dreams arent random and dont wake me up anymore and i dont feel that everyday should not end cause i didnt get everything done. If you feel the same and are wondering why you are like you are go to a behavioral therapist. You life WILL improve just as my therapist told me it would. Now to find Mrs. Right ;)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$3$5$"OKAY
column3: so I've been taking Adderall XR 10-15 mg for about 6 months now. Let me start off by saying
column4: yes
column5: my grades improved dramatically--moreso than they have in years.  However
column6: I noticed that my anxiety has gotten worse. I will get paranoid about stupid things that aren't worth getting paranoid about.  Does anyone know why this is? Plus
column7: when I first started taking it
column8: I could tell that my heart rate was moving much faster. That was annoying.  AND it really freaks me out that the one of the warnings on the label says
column9: ""May cause sudden death.""  WHHAAATTT???!!!  I guess it all depends on how many mg's you're taking
column10: right?  I don't know how some people are taking over 100 mgs of this stuff!!! Maybe they just have really bad symptoms of ADHD. I don't think I could ever let myself take more than 10-15 mgs of this stuff. The label does warn consumers of heart problems and things like that
column11: so I'll just stay at my current dosage.  It has helped me dramatically in school
column12: though! YAY!!!"

column1: 465$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/26/2008 11:14:23 PM$Reviewer: funkyjam
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$1$5$"I am  a 38 year old male. My ADHD diagnosis at the age of 35 was liberating. I saw the 'top' doctor in NYC who charged $750 and saw me for 15 minutes to make the diagnosis - promptly prescribing Adderall RX. Each subsequent $250 session lasted less than 5 minutes to monitor my progress on the Adderall RX. Initially things were great. I was able to focus on tasks
column3: I did not get drowsy driving and my appetite was manageable. I actually lost 12 pounds! I saw that as a positive side-effect. At the time I started
column4: I read that Adderall RX was the new Hollywood diet drug
column5: so I felt tres chic! Anyway
column6: it took me a while to realize that Adderall RX was making me less tolerant with more feelings of rage. At one point
column7: I broke a full length mirror in my wife's office by impulsively putting my shoe through it during a heated argument. I MUST NOTE THAT I HAVE NEVER DONE ANYTHING LIKE THIS BEFORE IN MY LIFE!!! I also felt what I could only describe as a pain in my liver after several months of taking the drug. If I stopped temporarily
column8: the pain went away. As soon as I resumed
column9: the pain came back. Another leading NYC expert consulted with a top expert at Mt. Sinai
column10: who had never heard of this side effect. Whether it was recorded or not
column11: I had it and don't since stopping the med. My course on Adderall RX lasted about 9 months. I also was in a n ADHD group therapy class. In the end
column12: I deceided that this is who I am
column13: that drugs are not a miracle cure and that the pain in my liver and feeling enraged was not something that was worth the extra focus and appetite suppression. I do keep a stash for long driving trips
column14: because it absolutely keeps me alert and I don't feel like I have to pull off the road to nap. Hope this helps. WOuld love to know if others felt this pain in their right side or
column15: as I describe
column16: my liver."

column1: 470$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/18/2008 4:53:41 PM$Reviewer: William
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$5$"I have been taking Adderall XR for nearly 5 years. I am now 41. I started on 20mg and noticed an immediate differance in my focus and energy. But soon the effectivness wore off and I went up to 40mg... then 60... then 80... then 100... then 120mg. I began to experience psychotic-like symptoms and my doctor pulled me back to 40mg. I dont feel like its doing anything for me anymore and I often find myself staring... just zoned out. You will always need more of this drug over time for it to actually work. It is highly addictive. I cant get out of the bed without it. It used to be my ""wonder drug"" in the beginning. I felt better and worked harder and smarter than I'd ever dreamed possible. Now I suffer with severe anxiety and cant focus on anything for very long. It causes irritability and keeps me from eating regular meals. But I am addicted to the energy it gives me and just today I told my psychiatrist not to take me off of it even though I have such bad anxiety. He isn't the same doctor that once prescribed 120mg. He really thinks I should come off of it. Deep down
column3: I believe I should too. Sometimes
column4: even on just 40mg I feel so wired. My eyes dilate
column5: my hands are always cold and I shake. I have to take Lunesta 3mg to go to sleep at every night. I will say that Adderall XR was only a short-lived fix for me. I have never been hyperactive... just attention deficit. If you are taking it
column6: maybe you will have better results than I have."

column1: 479$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/23/2008 10:48:18 PM$Reviewer: juststartedadderall
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$5$"So far I have only been on Adderall XR for about a week.  The only side affects I've noticed are it seems like it takes me longer to fall asleep at night.  I think the drug has helped me immensely
column3: I have been taking 20mg of Lexapro for about 4 years now and it has helped with my anxiety but my head always felt clouded
column4: I always felt like ""my get up and go got up and went"".  I was always just sluggish and wanting to nap all the time.  My attention span was always very short and I became bored with things very fast
column5: I was constantly punishing myself for daydreaming and trying to make myself focus.  The second day of being on Adderall XR was when I noticed the biggest differance
column6: and it has been the same since starting.  My thinking is SO MUCH clearer.  The constant ""background noise"" of continuous thoughts is gone.  I was afraid when I started the drug I would feel like I was on a caffeine overdose
column7: but it's not like that at all.  Your thoughts just clear
column8: I even speak slower
column9: I'm more focused on what is going on
column10: I don't even think about taking a nap anymore
column11: don't have a need to.  Things that I used to constantly procrastinate on just get finished.  Not only are you doing the things you didn't do before you have an enjoyment in doing them.  I have always felt that I was an anxious child growing up and I think that A LOT of my anxiety problems as an adult were definitely related to my ADHD.  So far I can't say anything bad about Adderall XR.  I take one 25mg capsule in the morning
column12: eat breakfast and go about my day.  The only other medications I take are a multivitamin and a fish oil supplement at lunch and Lexapro 20mg before bed.  I would highly recommend Adderall XR especially if you have anxiety and depression.  Good luck to all. "

column1: 494$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/22/2008 12:28:25 AM$Reviewer: AddictTotalAddict
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$2$5$"Addiction. That about sums it up. Too much of a good thing. It was typical. It made me feel great. It made me feel as though life was worth living. I wrote
column3: I focused
column4: I read
column5: then before I knew it
column6: the crash would hit. And I would pop another one. At one point
column7: I was up for FIVE DAYS with NO FOOD. Things start to go down hill on day 2. You can't focus as well
column8: your nerves are shot. You are weak. But man
column9: when that exhaustion hits
column10: it's so scary. I did this off and on for months until one day my doctor said
column11: ""No more."" This was because I finally told him
column12: ""Im out and I feel like I'm dying!"" I was taken off large doses 60-80mg a day for 4 months COLD TURKEY. I was out early. And this time I told him. I could not take it. I hard trouble just moving from the bed to to bathroom.I was SEVERELY depressed to the point of suicidal thoughts. I slept 23 hours a day for five days. My tolerance was though the roof. I could take 80 mg in the morning just to feel ""normal."" Finally a doctor took mercy on me and cut my dose down to 20 mg a day with the explicit understanding my mother would be doling them out to me. I weaned off them gradually. Finally down to 5 mg a day. The withdrawals from this drug when it abused is nothing short of the definition of hell. Exhaustion is complete and total. You are NON FUNCTIONAL.  It's hard to give it a rating because my addictive mind abused the hell out of it. If you have any history of substance abuse STAY CLEAR! WORST DRUG I EVER ABUSED AND I DID JUST ABOTU ALL OF THEM!"

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$5$5$From middle school on through part of high school

column4: but in my senior year of college
column5: decided to try adderall.  Heard good things
column6: and have noticed that it wakes me up almost like drinking a cup of coffee.  Definitely pay attention better
column7: but I may up my dosage

column1: 505$Condition: Other$10/1/2008 12:47:52 AM$Reviewer: Myon45
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I am an adult female age 52 that was FINALLY diagnosed with Adult Attention Deficit disorder in 1992 and had my doctor switch my medication to Adderall extended release 25 ml once a day and the results have been great. I take it first thing in the morning and it works all day until late afternoon. The problem I had with other meds was having to REMEMBER to take the second dose in the afternoon because being ADD I have a tendency of not paying attention to the time too closely and would remember too late in the afternoon to ake any more if i wanted to get to sleep that night at a regular time. Taking Adderall XR takes that problem away making my life flow a little easier.

column1: 516$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/9/2008 2:24:26 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$5$5$Excellent drug that has helped me dramatically.  The trick is getting the dosage correct.  Too low of a dose kept me up for 24 hours
column2: too high of a dose had me sleepy before noon.  With the correct dosage I sleep better than I have in years and can actually accomplish the things I need to get done.  As an adult I think it is great
column3: but I can see how it could be difficult for a child to handle this medication.  I am not saying that I would not give it to a child
column4: but I would be careful.  I am a 165lb
column5: 38 yr old male and a 20mg xr dose is perfect for me. The medication works differently on everyone
column6: but I could not imagine 60-90 mg daily. I am sure there are some that need it
column7: but I would never give a child that kind of dose. Best of luck to you

Switching over to Adderall stopped uncontrolable movements and twitches. My son who is 7 started to have more self control and has been able to socialize in a positive way. There are still lots to overcome but for the most part adderall has really helped to where we can now focus on teaching proper behavioral etiquette.

column1: 548$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/30/2008 11:35:20 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$5$
549$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/30/2008 3:22:38 PM$Reviewer: concernedparent
column2: Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver) $5$4$5$"My 9 year old son was diagnosed with ADD.  He was started on adderall xr 5mg  for 1 mo. then increased to 10mg.  It's been a total of 3mo. I think this is a perfect dose for him. We saw a difference the first day. He no longer ""daydreams""or have trouble understanding what people say to him (we had his hearing tested
column3: EEG's etc..).  Homework went from 3-4 hrs. to 1-2hrs. and it's done correctly! Most of the time he's done it all before he gets home. His grades went from C's and D's to A's and B's in one marking period. The side effects I've noticed are dry mouth and sometimes he's irritable with his 6 year old sister and he used to be extremely tolerant (it actually seems more normal now). He's lost 4lbs but he can afford it because he was 77lbs. I was worried about the slow growth side effect
column4: but he grew 1 in. since he started. I'm just not sure if I want him to take it during summer months or maybe I won't give it to him on the weekends.  This is something I'll discuss with his doctor.  It definetly works
column5: it's just one of those things you wish you didn't have to do."

column1: 550$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/28/2008 12:38:40 PM$Reviewer: Stephanie

It worked but we found that the 20 works the best.  I'm able to concetrate better at work.  I'm doing traing for my other job
column4: in school right now but this medication helps so much.  I've been getting 100% on all my test!  That never happens... I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for help with ADD.  It's great because you can tweek the dosage to find one that works for you.

554$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/11/2008 6:18:01 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  (Patient) $5$5$5$I started taking Adderall when I was 13 years old. I am now 22 and just recently started taking the drug again. I stopped taking adderall for about 2 years

column3: I only took it monday through friday
column4: and on the weekends i didnt take it because i didnt need it. I had no problem with that when i was younger
column5: ... but when i recently went back on adderall i notice that i go through withdrawls and have to take it everyday. I work in a dental office and ive noticed it has helped so much! I learned that in the years i went off adderall i developed coping skills with the condition
column6: like id write lists of what i needed to do. When your covered with blood
column7: you cant always refer back to your lists as easily as you'd like. It has deffinalty helped my responce time

column1: 555$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/10/2008 3:32:19 PM$Reviewer: Courtney250118

column1: 556$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/8/2008 10:06:19 PM$Reviewer: $4$4$5$I have been taking this for about a week now and i am able to focus a lot better but have this weird feeling in my right arm. Wondering if this will go away????
557$Condition: Other$4/1/2008 1:40:12 PM$Reviewer: classroom_drone
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$3$I am 23 years old and was diagnosed with ADD when i was 13. I was on adderall for 3 years and switched to XR after. I didnt notice the side effects until i was a senior in high school. I have struggled with sleeping
column3: relationships (due to the emotional effects i am overly sensitive and believe i have developed depression from it)
column4: loss of weight(especially earlier on
column5: not so much now. kinda wish it was the other way around after being in college 3 years)
column6: cotton mouth
column7: sexual side effects
column8: and most of all dependency. when i tried going off the drug for a year the withdrawals were hard to deal with. i slept most of the day for about a month and gained  weight from increased appetite. after the withdrawals had finally ended
column9: i felt happier and easier to be around. my relationships were great and my depression was gone. all side effects had disappeared. i felt more like myself off the drug. but my grades in school suffered. i got back on the dosage and all the old side effects came back. my grades improved
column10: but i am back to the empty sole less feeling of a study drone. my current relationship is suffering and i dont sleep much. i will be on the drug until i graduate. as soon as i do
column11: i will be saying goodbye forever to it. i love my parents and know they were trying to do the best thing for me. If i have kids one day
column12: and they are diagnosed with ADD
column13: i wont be putting them through the same hell i have suffered for the past decade. ADD has been around much longer than it has had a drug for it and most people seemed to have still lived a good life with out it(my dad for example). I would not recommend putting your kids on this drug early on in their lives. wait until they can fully understand the side effects of the drug and let them make the choice because this is a life changing decision that is extremely hard to revert back from. if your child is happy
column14: isnt that the most important. im still scared what the long term effects of the drug will do to me down the road.

column1: 562$Condition: Other$3/17/2008 2:15:29 PM$Reviewer: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Adderall is a marvelous drug for those who truly have ADHD. It increases reaction time by 150%

column2: CPhT
column3: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$"This medicine has worked wonders for me! I am a pharmacy technician

column1: My mom was afraid to put me on anything. She has since passed away from cancer and I decided to take charge and go to a doctor.
My doctor has been very
column2: very friendly with me. He is a general practitioner and he always asks me how I am doing on it. When I began going to him
column3: the dr asked me what I would recommend for the medicine for me to be on.

column1: The first choice was Daytrana. I noticed nothing from that medicine.
Next was Ritalin SR 20. It worked..but gave me headaches.
Next try was adderall 10mg BID (Twice daily). It seemed to work
column2: but my schedule didn't really allow me to keep taking it. I also didn't like bringing a C-2 drug to work.

column1: So he asked me about adderall XR. I told him that it was worth a try
column2: and since 10mg twice daily wasn't working
column3: let's up it even more.

column1: What a great decision!! Adderall XR 30mg once daily is working! I am now accepted more by my peers.

column1: 578$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/7/2008 9:51:56 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I was diagnosed with ADD when I was 6 years old. I went thru lots of tests and many trips to the psychiatrist. (Can be very terrifying for a 6 year old)I started taking Ritalin for about 8 years. When I entered high school I started taking Adderall XR 20 mg. I love this medication. Itâs very easy to take. I feel satisfied with my work ethic and I constantly have my eye on the ball. The only thing I find hard is
column2: I have a problem with socializing while on the medication. Itâs hard for me to have conversations that arenât related to work. Guess you can say that I'm in the ZONE. (Not trying to freak any one out but is basically legal âspeedâ) I don't eat much either. I only take Adderall Monday-Friday. I used to take it everyday but I felt as if I were in a ""coma"" like state. Sometimes I'll forget to take my med. before work and what a HUGE difference I'm very sensitive
column3: and I feel like I can eat a horse. My family
column4: friends and co-workers know about my disorder. I don't feel embarrassed about it; itâs a part of me that I canât control."

column1: 579$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/6/2008 11:28:55 PM$Reviewer: el Bee
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$3$5$"I was diagnosed ONE day before a consultant decided to change my job from interesting to  BOR-ing.  Hearing this
column3: my Dr. decided to begin with one 30mg dose of AdderallXR first thing in the morning and 30mg at noon.  As I attempted to perform the boring tasks of my ""new"" job--anxiety increased so high it seemed I would snap in two--thus
column4: I resigned.

column1: At this
column2: my Dr. switched me to one 30mg XR and one generic non-extended release of 10mg at noon.  The anxiety lessened and I found I could focus on things like never before (the bad side is
column3: sometimes I focus on things I DON'T NEED to do and hours pass as I search the web as I was doing just now).

column1: While on the 60mg XR
column2: even though I experienced a heightened level of anxiety
column3: I did an experiment and for the first time in my LIFE
column4: I was actually able to make an outline
column5: a REAL outline for a speech!  As a public speaker
column6: this is pretty important.

column1: One strange side effect--before Adderall
column2: I had stopped biting my nails and now I can't keep from chewing and ripping at them.  I have to glue on plastic nails to stop.  Also
column3: I can't seem to fall asleep before about 1:30 AM
column4: even if I take it at 7AM. But OFF of this drug
column5: I used to feel lethargic almost all day and perk up at night
column6: and on this dose
column7: I have no more lethargy and I never nap at all during the day--I actually feel like a normal
column8: thinking human being.  I wonder
column9: what could be wrong with that
column10: even if it IS addictive?  I'm not sure.

column1: Honestly
column2: It's as if it connected those pieces of my 52 year-old brain that were never connected before...Adderall is not perfect--sometimes I have menopausal episodes of angst that are exacerbated by taking this stimulant
column3: but even my husband noticed a marked change.  I am more ""real"" on this mind-assisting additive than not.

column1: Angst and nail-biting aside
column2: it's as if it has helped me find who I really am--helped my frontal lobe behave normally.  I don't want to go backward in processing information. It's so much better now... "

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver) $5$5$5$My 7 yr. old son was diagnosed about 1 1/2 yrs. ago with ADHD. We started out with Concerta which worked for a month
column3: but we never saw a great improvement with his symptoms. He has been on Adderall for over a year and fianally last month we reached peak satisfaction. This drug is great
column4: but ADHD is a disease that you constantly have to monitor and keep in close contact with your health care provider. His dosage over a year has increased from 10-25 milligrams. So
column5: if you are like me and expect that a miracle will occur and symtoms resolve after a short period of time
column6: do not give up
column7: things will gradually improve and then one day you look at your child and realize that he no longer has significant symptoms of ADHD. My son no longer gets in trouble at school and has been on the A honor roll for quite some time. Adderall has been a wonderful choice for my child.

column1: 615$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/26/2007 8:53:05 AM$Reviewer: TTwiix
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was diagnosed with ADD in 3rd grade. I was put on Ritalin and it was not good for me. My parents took me off and thought I had been misdiagnosed. Fast Forward to college where I am struggling with my school work. One class in particular I am studying for days and getting D's. I was rediagnosed and given adderall. My grades improved from mostyl C's to A's and B's. A positive side effect: I would take it as soon as I got up in the morning and it made it easy for me to make it to early classes. I did experience dry mouth but it wasnt intolerable. Once in a while I would have trouble sleeping but some people say they sleep better on this because their thoughts dont race before bed. As for mood swings I didnt experience any. Some people might have said I wasn't as cheery but it was because I was so focused on getting something done I didnt have time to be distracted. I consider this a good thing. I did like the XR pills better. I have been off of my meds for 2 years and feel I should get back onto it for my job.
