column1: 635$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/23/2007 2:44:18 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have ADD
column2: not ADHD.  I noticed a difference in my cognitive abilities almost immediately after using Adderall XR.  The 30 mg capsule made my heart race
column3: so my dosage was reduced to 25 mg. The ideal dose for me would probably be somewhere in between 25 mg and 30 mg. My symptoms gradually worsened over a period of 30+ years and resulted in multiple job losses
column4: divorces and financial difficulties.  I was not accurately diagnosed until age 45
column5: although I had virtually all of the classic ADD symptoms dating back to childhood.  About 5 or 6 years ago I actually wondered if I had some type of learning disability because I could not process a complete thought
column6: could not retain spoken information or instructions
column7: was unable to concentrate on any task
column8: etc. Although I discussed this concern with my psychiatrist at the time
column9: there was no mention of the possibility of ADD.  I was given additional medication to treat my existing anxiety & depression
column10: which did nothing to improve my ADD symptoms. However
column11: on my first visit with a new psychiatrist several years later
column12: I was given the diagnosis of ADD.  Of course
column13: it would have been great to have been accurately diagnosed and treated years ago
column14: but I am grateful to have found help at all.  I could have spent the rest of my life suffering if not for someone new taking a fresh look at my case.

""If he would just buckle down and do the work...his mind wanders...he refuses to get his work done. He's unprepared...he always has an excuse... He's disorganized."" I heard these comments from everyone. I frustrated my teachers
column3: my parents and myself. I couldn't pay attention. School was a nightmare that seemed to last forever. I couldn't wait for each class to end. Yet I would do well on tests. I'd get terrible grades for class participation and homework assignments
column4: but then I would get an A or a B on midterms and finals and end up with a B or a C in the course. In college I discovered amphetamines
column5: which are much stronger than Adderall but had the same effect on my ability to concentrate. I'd be failing a course all semester
column6: skipping classes
column7: losing my homework
column8: etc.
column9: but then I'd get some ""speed"" and learn the entire course from the book in a couple of days and ace the final. I was accused of cheating once because professor didn't believe I could have learned so much in such a short period. I was self-medicating
column10: but I didn't know it. There was no such thing as ADD or ADHD in the 60's and 70'. I thought there was something wrong with me and I was wrong to take amphetamines. I couldn't take them all the time; the side effects were extreme. After college
column11: I had to accept mediocrity in almost everything
column12: but I got by. At 50
column13: a shrink finally recognized my ADHD and prescribed Adderall. One of the best days of my life. No more antidepressants
column14: no more confusion and no more procrastination and mediocre achievement. The fog had lifted. My life is so much better in every way. I've learned to accept that where I am today is the culmination of everything I've ever done. I can't regret that because I am happier now than I've ever been. Medical science has saved me. My newfound ability to think and act rationally has made it so I can help others through this sometimes confusing life.

column1:
647$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/17/2018 6:59:01 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$
648$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/13/2018 7:49:21 PM$Reviewer: Darby1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was misdiagnosed for the first 17 years of my life
column2: I was forced to take antidepressants that scared me and didn't work. I failed at everything. I would have emotional outbursts from being so overwhelmed. I saw so many doctors and counselors I felt like I was broken and no one was able to ""fix"" me. As I grew up I learned ways to manage my symptoms but it was exhausting. If i was succeeding at any point it always ended with failure or side tracked resulting in countless unfinished things that made me feel incompetent. ""Jack of all trades; master at none"". I knew I was capable of so much more but the distractions of hearing
column3: seeing
column4: feeling
column5: smelling everything in my environment all at the same time made me dizzy and I couldn't sort it all out. It wasnt until a little over a year ago I began therapy
column6: seeing a wonderful Psychiatrist who UNDERSTOOD ME! For the first time in my life i was reassured i wasnt alone. Apprehensively I began taking this medicine
column7: it took over 6 months to start feeling in control of my mind
column8: but now I have it figured out. Instead of hearing music
column9: I am listening to the instruments. I can single out the drummer and follow his beats to the end. I am maintaining a high GPA in college
column10: I am organized
column11: efficient and I no longer feel like a crack in the sidewalk of life. I hate that people without a diagnosis
column12: who aren't struggling are abusing this medicine that helps so many people function at high capacity who truly need it! The biggest draw back for me is seeing what I could've done years ago but didn't. I have noticed my heart rate goes up spontaneously which can be scary
column13: but it does pass. I have to learn to give myself credit for my successes
column14: I am not my medication or ADHD but they have both added to the positives of who I am. If you have been struggling
column15: reach out!"

column1: 650$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/24/2018 6:22:44 AM$Reviewer: CLBK
column2: 55-64 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I was fortunate to have a Doctor that asked questions and diagnosed me in my 40's. column3: doesn't take my appetite away ( I often wish it would!) I still occasionally need a nap during the day and have no problem falling asleep at night. I've always had low blood pressure
column4: low body temperature

column8: I'm female and 60 years old.

column1: 651$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/4/2018 9:30:37 PM$Reviewer: Ize
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"Made college a possibility for me. I was able to focus and perform well in my classes. Before that I had been failing but knew I could do more than my grades were showing. Over the years (17 or so I believe) I have remained on the same dose with no side effects. I have since been promoted at work and although I am struggling to learn time management on a whole new level I suspect that is normal and not due to ADHD. I continue to take my medication to maintain a level of ""normal"" cognative function like everyone else. Otherwise everything that crossed my mind would cross my lips and I couldn't keep my emotions in check. I would easily be overwhelmed by projects or anything that involved multiple steps and people depending on me. I would wilt under the pressure. Adderall allows me the ability to focus my thoughts and slow my mental process down. Filter the thousand bits of input I'm bombardrd with every moment. I can see the forrest through the leaves... This medication has been pivotal to my success and I was able to stop taking antidepressants after being on Adderall. I finally felt normal. Hopefully my review helps put a parent at ease when considering if they should put their child on Adderall or not. "

As time went on he became more aggressive threatening to stab his father with a butcher knife & constantly going up against his dad & peers at school. He distroyed things in his path & punched holes in the walls of our home
column3: yelling & cursing when anyone rubbed him the wrong way. The slightest things would set him off into fits of rage. He took on multiple personalities one being very evil as if Satan's son. He was a Jeckyll & Hyde.  This went on for 4 years as the dosage was increased because of his high tolerance to Adderall. After being in support groups & reading up I discovered other we're experiencing these very same side affects. I demanded the doctor to take him off of it and since he's been off of it for 6 months now & almost instantly I got my sweet boy back. I read that Adderall was like taking crystal meth. This medicine needs to be removed from the market permanently in my opinion. He was in & out of the hospital 4 times in a 3 months time frame. He ended up for the first time in his life getting in trouble with the police for assault on an officer
column4: resisting arrest & interfering with police business. Adderall is a very dangerous medication. If you benefit from it without the bad side affects
column5: then that is good. If not

I wanted to avoid it if at all possible due to its stigma and popularity on the streets. I regret not trying it sooner because it works wonders for me! I am prescribed 30mg twice daily (i have severe ADHD) and it's really helpful. The reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I do find if I take it for an extended period of time it becomes less effective
column3: but when that happens i'll stop taking it for about a week or two and it will go back to working like a charm. I'm so glad I am prescribed it
column4: every aspect of my life has improved since taking Adderall. it made my ADHD easier to manage
column5: my social life better
column6: my marks increased significantly
column7: and helped basically every negative symptom that comes with having ADHD. One downside I will mention
column8: it is very expensive.

774$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/20/2014 10:00:56 PM$Reviewer: Alex, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was on Strattera for about 5 years and switching to adderall has been one of the best decisions i've made. Adderall is essentially like taking 10 red bulls. It can work for longer periods, but the biggest bonus is the quality of work that I can produce. The reason being, adderall gives me the ability to be able to be much more focused on the material and as a result, I retain it better. There is a downside however. If taken too late in the day, it can keep you awake and sometimes you can feel a bit overstimulated. Another thing to watch for may be a slight change in behaviour. I had family members that hadn't seen me in several months tell me that I seemed too stimulated during regular conversation. In terms of dosage, I personally found 20mg to be more than enough but this varies from person to person. Overall my experience has been great, it has helped me bridge that gap that has kept me from performing like the rest of the students in my classes.
775$Condition: Other$6/17/2014 6:43:28 PM$Reviewer: Me, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I was only using 10 mg for about 3 yrs. it was just enough to help me be more focused, even out my emotions and have more sustainable energy. As long as I was excersizing regularly, eating healthy and getting the sleep my body needed, I never felt I needed more than 10 mg. Once I started to slack in my healthy eating and regular excersize, I started to become more sluggish and unfocused and eventually jumped up to 15mg. I don't love how it makes me feel. After 6 months of the 15mg I felt I could use more but decided that I was not going to fall victim so once again, I have been getting back on track with my eating and excersize and have lost 5 pds  and already feel so much better. I do not crave more Adderall so by continuing good healthy habits, i'll see if I need to adjust back to 10 mg or stay on the 15 mg. I've learned that Adderall is not a substitute for unhealthy habits.

779$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/4/2014 10:21:56 AM$Reviewer: mandyslayton, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking adderall xr for almost 3 years now.
It has changed my life for the better.
I am a 35 year old female who my parents didn't believe in me taking drugs like this as a child.I knew I had issues in high school
and I know for a fact had I been on this medication I would have done better in school
and would have cared about going to college.

I finally did something for myself when I turned 30 and went to a psychiatrist. It took a few different medications(concerta/vyvanse) before my Dr put me on Adderall. One made me so dizzy and one made my heart race.
I can see getting addicted
column2: but I knew with the way I live my life
column3: I wouldn't have to worry.

column1: I had major issues staying focused and awake no matter how much sleep I would get. I would get bored easily or start a dozen different tasks and not get one completed. I had no time management.
I started with 20mg and I take it in the am when I wake up at 6 am. It makes me want to do my job and not get stressed. I am much more
organized. It keeps my life on track.
I started getting headaches about 3 months in and just really tired again by 3 pm. When I went to my dr for a check up she decided to
try a half of a 20mg of plain adderall at 2pm.
It did the trick and I've been on this combination ever since and haven't had to change anything.
I go to bed by 10:30 or 11 pm. I hardly ever have trouble sleeping.  My heart doesn't race either.
A plus for me was it helped lose the weight from having my daughter a few years prior. I gained 70lbs and wasn't worried about losing
the last 30lbs but it was an added plus.
I don't have such an appetite loss like I did when I first started.
It helps me with portion control and I don't stuff my face like I used to before I started the medication.
It also helps me have normal bowel movements and regular.
I will tell you if I have to stay up later I do end up irritable and get quiet and just want to crash. That's about the only side effect I've experienced.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver) $5$3$4$BE ADVISED: It is reported by a small % of patients who take Adderall with multiple other prescribed & OTC medications have led to unresolved false positives on a variety of Urine Drug Tests indicating methamphetamine use when the patient was not using any illicit drugs. column3: as an alternate regimen may be necessary to prevent this incorrect findings. 796$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/22/2014 10:17:58 AM$Reviewer: AdderallForADHD, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$2$I gave this medication a 2 out of 5 for Ease of Use because I have had a few issues with dosage size and perscription. When I lost a significant amount of weight (due to health changes - NOT the medication), my Dr. thought it might be best to alter my medication system, and for the next year my dose and brand was shuffled around, as a result every pharmacist in town thinks I am some cartel drug dealer. But once on the right dose for your body, Adderall is incredible for those with Attention Deficit. It will not cause shakiness or nervousness. It will have a calming effect while in your system. I can generally think much more clearly and am able to multi-task. If you need Adderall, it will work for you and you will NOT have the same reaction to it as someone taking speed. The medication for someone with ADHD will slow you, in a sense: making it clear and possible to make simple, rational decisions without struggle and giving you the ability to channel your energy and focus on what you need. I take 2 25mg XRs throughout the day, and have an optional add on of 10mg instant release for if I have a lot of homework or my XR wears off (I am a student, and mostly use the extra during exams or if I am writing a last minute essay the night before). I am an 18y/o 115 lb girl and pretty skinny, and this is the dose that works well for me (it deffinately isn't the same for everyone). The only problem I have found with Adderall is that on nights I take the optional 10mg, I have some trouble sleeping. But it's alright, because I don't take it often and usually if I do I need to stay awake that night anyways. However, if you do not have to pull frequent all-nighters, I would recommend never taking Adderall within  4 hours of your bedtime. Other than that, Adderall has provided me with the ability to focus in class, on my friends, after school, and accomplish the things I need to do, without ever getting too distracted or forgetting what I had to do.

806$Condition: Other$4/5/2014 11:37:27 PM$Reviewer: gratefullyfocused, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I am a 54 year old male. I did not put two and two together when ADHD first came to light. It did not take long to realize the connection between ADHD and my younger days. I new years ago when ADHD was medically proven and legitimized (for lack of a better description) that it was my problem. I had learned to deal with it by working harder and longer than others would have to for the same results. I would accomplish what I needed to but where others would do it in an 8 hour work day, I would take it home and spend another 2 to 3 hours to accomplish the same amount of work to have it available at the same time as everyone else. A typical 8 hour day for anyone else was a 10 to 12 hour day for me. (this also helped me understand as an intelligent person the struggles in high school). This system worked for me as I progressed in my career until my latest and highest level management position. It didn't take long for me to realize I had progressed professionally beyond my ability to overcome my focus problems using the system that had gotten me by to this point to overcome the issue. The difference after Adderall has been profound, I have no doubt that had I not discussed the problem with my doctor and began taking Adderall I would have lost the position I now hold. This is coming from someone who at 54 years old was on no prescription medication for anything and proud of that accomplishment.

column1: 863$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/10/2013 1:44:49 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver) $5$5$5$If you truly need this medication and are on the correct dosage
column2: it will not cause shakiness or nervousness. It will have a calming effect while in your system. You will think more clearly and be able to multi-task. I've seen comments saying this is no different than meth or crack. That is inaccurate. If you need Adderall
column3: it will work for you and you DO NOT have the same reaction to it as someone taking speed. If you feel this way and have been diagnosed with ADHD your dose maybe too high or you might be a good candidate for the XR version. My husband's metabolism is too fast for extended release. He takes two doses a day to keep his level stable. This medication actually slows him in a sense. He is still very active but can focus and accomplish tasks effectively.

column2: Paxil
column3: Lexapro
column4: Klonopin
column5: etc for depression
column6: confusion
column7: lack of self worth
column8: crying.  Finally
column9: my Pain Management doctor
column10: who maintains my drug infusion pump gave me a prescription for Adderall XR.  I immediately noticed an improvement in my mental state.  I had more energy
column11: felt more stable
column12: better concentration
column13: even more able to deal with my chronic pain.  I started on 10 Mg daily and increased over time.  I am now on 40 mg XR daily.  I am certain that I could use another increase
column14: but I prefer stay as low as possible for as long as possible.  I will say that this has been the absolute best medication I have ever been on and the only one that dealt effectively with my depression.  I have never been able to deal with life in such a positive
column15: focused  and calm manner.  I hope I never have to stop taking this medication.  Even my Psychiatrist has noticed the difference in me and he recommends that I continue on this medication.  He said he is willing to prescribe it for me if there should ever be a reason I stop requiring the services of the doctor who prescribes it for me now.  I have been under treatment with the same psychiatrist for 12 years and he agrees that this medicine has been the best prescription for improving my depression and dealing with other very complicated issues in my life.  So
column16: for right now
column17: he says continue the good work and he is very pleased that I have found the correct medication. Over the course of therapy

column19: if necessary

column1: 927$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/11/2013 10:25:56 AM$Reviewer: Thankful
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I came to this site today to review opinions between ""Brand"" and generic Adderrall and thought I should add my personal experience with this medication.

column1: I was diagnosed with depression 14 years ago and was prescribed Paxil. After six months of little change in my condition
column2: I was prescribed Prozac and Xanax. Over the next few years
column3: my conditioned worsened. I was eventually prescribed Ambien for insomnia
column4: which was a huge mistake.

column1: I became addicted to Ambien
column2: not for the sleep benefits but for the Utopian feeling it provided me. I would take it several times during the day
column3: and quickly began running out of my prescriptions. This led to ""Doc Shopping
column4: and eventually I had three doctors writing me scripts every month.

column1: Long story short: my marriage fell apart
column2: I couldn't hold a job and I reached a point where I didn't care whether I lived or died.

column1: Three years ago
column2: I made an appt. with a young doctor at a university research facility. After describing my medical history and my current condition
column3: he said he believed I suffered from adult ADD. He started me on 10 mg of Adderall daily.

column1: Within two months
column2: I was completely off my depression meds (Cymbalta and Tofrenil) and had no desire whatsoever for the Ambien.

column1: I have now been taking 30 mg daily for the past year
column2: and am experiencing no addictive drug behavior whatsoever. I was also a daily drinker
column3: and now only drink 1-2 glasses of wine on the weekends. I have held a steady
column4: professional-level job for over three years now
column5: and my marriage has been restored.

column1: Through the grace of God
column2: I was led to a doctor who literally saved my life. This amazing drug has helped make all the difference. If you have been diagnosed with depression and nothing seems to help
column3: you may want to discuss this with your doctor."

I would start one thing then stop that and start something else....finishing neither task. I became very fidgety and also lethargic as well. My thought process was chaotic. My husband had passed away in January of 2013 and along with the grief from my loss, I also experienced deeper depression. There were things I wanted to do and things I NEEDED to do and just couldn't muster up the energy to do anything. There were many days that I didn't feel like getting dressed, washing up, brushing my teeth or even leaving the house. I also had the added task of finding a job. I remained unemployed during the time of my husband's sickness until his death-about 10 months. I couldn't even MAKE myself do anything! And that was depressing in itself. My doctor tried me on Adderall and it was a godsend! I was up and showered and dressed every morning, got caught up on housework, began the job hunt and became more social. I hope she never takes me off of it!

It was alot like making a deal with the devil.  YOU WILL BE SUCCESSFUL AT WHAT YOU DO.  YOU WILL GET ADDICTED.  It will stop working the same and u will not get the benifits u once received.  Coming down is not fun.  I started drinking everynight to even out my moods at night.  If not I would get very aggitated and angry.  I made well over a million dollars in the last year, but every emotional/personal issue took a back seat.  Do not take Adderall if you have a family.  You will regret it.

985$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/8/2013 8:24:04 AM$Reviewer: Onslo, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$Wonder drug ! I wish I had it when I was in school. I was labeled as a problem kid. Lazy,  always  in trouble. In the remedial classes in most subjects. Could not pay attention to things that were not interesting to me. Age 44 is when I was given my first dose of adderall. My kids were taking it for ADD. My doctor was treating me with anti depressants with no real results. He gave me a simple test to take in his office. Switched me to adderall to see if things in my life improved. With in just a few days I noticed Hugh improvements in my life. I was able to do things that I could never do before. Like understanding what I had just read, being able to focus on things that were always a challenge to me,so I avoided them. I could understand new concepts and enjoyed learning for the first time in my life. Before I struggled with following basic instructions and would get frustrated and just give up.  For me it was a new life that I could enjoy and be present and be part of things I was scared to get involved in. For fear that others would think I was slow or challenged. Adderall change my whole life for the better. I wonder where I would be today if I had been given this drug in my early school years. I own a very successfully catering business and I'm happy with my life. I will always wonder what I could have accomplished if I was given the right treatment when I was in school. 
986$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/1/2013 7:35:53 AM$Reviewer: peach, 45-54 Female  (Patient) $4$4$4$been on it 1 week for severe untreatable depression.  has been working great.
987$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/26/2013 2:58:08 PM$Reviewer: Christine Tobey, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on Adderall for about 2 years nows due to a decrease in mental ability to what I call""  Mentally Keep Up"".  As a nurse working nights on a very busy floor that I truly Love & Self Employed Auto Dealership
column2: I became more & more scatter brained & stressed due to the inability to stay focused.  Adderall has made life so much better
column3: in that I can focus & get things done as I once did with out all the stress & un organized state of mind.  It has not caused me to have weight loss
column4: infact I have gained & maintain with difficulty to loose weight.  I sleep well when I do sleep & it is just such a miracle drug for me.  I notice when I have taken vacations from it
column5: I can not think for myself & I can NOT stay still long enough  when trying to sit at my desk to get work done.   I am very concerned about the ability to get COMPLETELY off this drug & function as I should.  Haven't got that far yet but will surely let you know when or if I do.   Important need of Adderral for me is that is slows me down MENTALLY so that I can properly function & think as I should in orders to focus & concentrate on very important & large amounts of work.  I was told by my doctor I was a TRUE canidate for this drug & I must agree.  I have Never been on any medication in my life.  This is the first & I am 51 years old.

989$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/8/2013 12:39:46 PM$Reviewer: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$2$5$I only took adderall for about four months before I had to stop. It worked wonders of my focus is school and controlled my hyperactivity really well for the most part, but the side effects were just too much. Heart palpitations, no appetite whatsoever and nausea, but the worst by far was the anxiety. I would have four or five panic attacks a week just from tiny things like homework, and it drove me crazy. I ended up switching medications a couple months ago, and I'm doing much better now. These meds work great but DO NOT take them if you have a fast heart rate to begin with or are already prone to worrying/anxiety.

Im out of the house after being in there so long.Thru complications Iam now seeking a doctor that will prescribe this med. Ihave sunk back into severe depression and chronic pain is taking over my life once again. i am permantly disabled I suffer from diabetes w diabetic neuropathy, degenerative bone disease,fibromyalgia,depressin &anxiety& im back to where I was 1 yr ago. Im scared of what my life will be w/o this. those who know me have seen an incredible change. Ijust want to be normal. This is a cry for help with nowhere to turn. pls contact me Ihave medicare and medicaid do not contact me unless you are a M.D.orPhsyciatrist.My life is on hold until I get help.I can become jst another statistic unless treated.

1008$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/20/2013 3:50:55 PM$Reviewer: head injury, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$3$5$Taking Adderall (generic)10mg 2st month and 20 mg 2nd month I begain losing my hair and my eyelashes were falling out (quite noticeable).  I stopped using it for a a couple of months (in between used ritalin [generic not as effective with focus and concentration] and my eyelashes grew back and my hair was not back to where it was before I started taking aderall but it stopped thinning, I was having nightmares and evil dreams, my eyes were so dried that I would wake up in pain in the middle of the night and have to put eye drops in, constipation, and racing thoughts.  I started taking the NAME BRAND Adderall a few months afterwards because I thought maybe the side effects were from the fillers because I am very sensitive to some medications.  I was able to concentrate and focus and become a normal person but again, slowly but surely, my eyelashes started to fall out and my eyes were dry but not as bad as on the generic brand--the dry eyes I could have tolerated, but I had to stop the Adderall or lose my hair on my head and eyelashes. Aside from the hair loss, I would have stayed on the NAME BRAND Adderall.  It was like I had chemotherapy and my hair was falling out.
1009$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/14/2013 6:21:24 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$While I was initially skeptical of taking this medication because of my professional life (I'm an active-duty commissioned officer in the United States Air Force) I must admit that this mdication has changed my life. Not only was this medication life-changing, it only took hours for me to realize the bennifits of the treatment in terms of subsidence of my ADHD symptoms. While others have experienced problems with Adderall and its generic forms, I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND anyone suffering with serious, life-altering ADHD symptoms (as I was) consult your primary care physican or mental health care provider and see if this is an option for you. Believe me, I understand the challenges associated with both the stigma associated with ADHD generally and this medication specifically, but I promise that if this treatment is as effective for you as it was for me you'll kick yourself for waiting so long to try it (just like I did)!

I have found that I am able to do menial tasks like housework, stay on task for helping my 11yo with homework, stay on task for craft projects and am able to keep a cool head when amongst stressful situations. Also I am playing darts in leauge and when it comes to state darts or any tournament, you can tell when I am have not taken my dose properly. I do need however my iPod when playing as well. I do not have an appetite and do sometimes stress eat, but I have been able to take better control my eating. With Adderall I have been able to take back my life, instead of this condition take control of me. I reccomend this medication for anyone who cannot find the right med for them. 1021$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/28/2013 5:21:33 PM$Reviewer: [emailÂ protected], 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I was raised in a verbal

I had cervical cancer & had a partial hysterectomy @ age 26. In 2003 @ the age of 15 my only son was killed in a horrific alcohol related auto accident. My brother was the driver.

column1: I lost interest in everything.I lost everything.I cut myself off from even my best friend. I turned to drugs & alcohol(which I swore to NEVER do after the life I endured)for about 3 yrs. YES I wanted to die
column2: but never once thought of suicide. One day I just decided I had enough & quit all the nonsense. I did not seek help until 7 yrs after his death. I am now 43. Since I was a teen I noticed I had problems concentrating
column3: seeing things through to the end
column4: lack of interest. Daily headaches
column5: some leading to migraine. Multiple projects going at once. Occasional panic attacks & anxiety. I am so O.C.D. about certain things that I get on my own nerves. The panic attacks & anxiety have progressed over the years so I take xanax as well.  After trying several anti depressants that NEVER worked. & after seeing the results my daughter had with the Adderall
column6: I asked to try it. It has made such a difference in my life. I can actually concentrate long enough to complete what I start. I have found my passion for my art again. All this time & All the different medications I have tried
column7: people tell me it is a miracle cure for me & can attest to the fact that I feel like a NORMAL human being for once in my life..........I am extremely scared to death of this medication though.... I NEVER want to go back to whoever I was before Adderal Yet I don't want to become dependant on it & have to take it forever....rock & a hard place on this one...It is only thing I have found that actually works yet the aspect of the methamphetamine scares me. column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$4$"I was treated for major depression and anxiety disorders for many years
column3: with ADHD being a secondary diagnosis.  My Psychiatrist turned things around out of lack of any more ideas
column4: and treated my ADHD as my primary diagnosis.

column1: The results have been amazing.  Adderall stops the anxiety and panic attacks completely.  Unfortunately
column2: it's a very short-acting medication with me
column3: so I only get 3 hours of relief from it.  Those 3 hours are worth it
column4: just to be able to breathe after many years of constant anxiety.

column1: ADHD makes it difficult for me to finish any tasks
column2: clean my house
column3: or take care of pressing paperwork. All of this leads to extreme anxiety
column4: then depression.  By treating the ADHD first
column5: I am able to focus more
column6: get some things done
column7: and the anxiety and depression over it all lessens.

column1: Dependence is definitely an issue... you must be careful to take it only as directed.  I take it every other day or so
column2: when I need to focus
column3: and trying not to become dependent. When I do take it every day
column4: I can feel myself needing it more often
column5: as the anxiety gets worse.

column1: It's not perfect
column2: but I finally have some relief from depression and anxiety after 20 years."

1061$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/19/2012 11:44:55 AM$Reviewer: kris, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Before getting diagnosed and taking medication, my life was difficult and stressful.  I'm in graduate school and ever since I was younger I always had to study 2-4 times harder than everyone else just to get the same grade.  I was constantly losing everything, forgetting what I had been doing, and forgetting important things/events.  Now I've been taking a generic adderall and my life is so much easier.  I have spent less time studying and am finally able to organize things without getting distracted every 5 min.  Adderall is not good for everyone with ADHD and different treatments are available.  After my experience on medication, I would recommend that people with ADHD at least try some sort of medication.  All of my friends who have ADD/ADHD take medication and are just fine.  There are some side effects, but those are generally mild and go away after some time.  All in all, adderall has helped me a lot in graduate school, and I don't think I would be able to finish without it.

column1: 1067$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/8/2012 10:02:33 AM$Reviewer: rewindmind
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"Adderall has helped me focus and actually complete a task or a 'to do' list. Can't believe what a difference it makes. My husband used to 'poo-poo' me...you are lazy
column3: just focus
column4: why can't you get anything done? I thought I was losing my mind. Was tested for ADD/ADHD by a psychiatric doctor who said I was anxious and depressed and prescribed Xanax....that made me sleepy and more disconnected.

column1: Finally found a nurse practitioner who recognized my symptoms right away. Sitting in her office
column2: I couldn't even keep my feet/legs still....always felt as if I needed to be doing something!! Within three days
column3: I couldn't believe the difference. I can focus at work
column4: I can listen to a conversation without having my mind race at all the 'things' I need to complete. Just wish I would have had this in college...a lot of my professors thought I was just a scatterbrain...

column1: One of the best commercials on TV was my ah-ha moment. A woman is sitting in a conference room--in a meeting with many others. The camera focuses on her face and she has thoughts racing through her mind
column2: the announcer says...""her mind is like a television that can't find the right channel"" shows constantly changing channels/commercials...Oh my...that is me...!! I knew I needed to find someone to help me. If this sounds like you...search until you find a health care provider that will listen. The first doc I saw
column3: made me think there was something seriously wrong with me
column4: even after all the ADHD tests. The Nurse Practitioner diagnosed me at the first visit.

column1: I have no issues with this medication
column2: no shaking or nervousness...the opposite effect actually. One complaint
column3: it is amphetamine  salts...there is a 'salty' taste in my mouth--occasionally. I drink lots of water during the day
column4: that seems to help. "

1086$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/5/2012 3:36:05 AM$Reviewer: If I only knew, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$As a child I never really knew that i had a short attention span. I've always had a hard time in school, but I really noticed it whenever I got into college. No matter how much I studied I couldn't seem to retain any information. About a year ago I went to my doctor and found out I have ADD. I never knew I had it until I looked back at my childhood and all the way to me now as an adult. I was put on adderall 20mg twice a day my life actually became normal. For the first time in my life I actually heard a clock ticking while talking to family. My ability to stay focused and on task was just the best feeling in the world. My life has very organized and I can hold interest in studying, my work, as well as my social life. The only downfall about adderall was that it had an extreme supression of my appetite and I had no extra weight to lose. After I would come down off of my doseage I get very irritable, not sure if it's a side effect from the drug or the fact I work 3rd shift as a police officer and rarely sleep good. But overall this has been a blessing to me and my ability to do better at work and at home. If I only had this when I was a young kid and in school I believe my grades would have been out of this world!

1093$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/29/2012 7:36:03 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$1$5$I've been prescribed 20mg of Adderall IR 3 times daily since I was 15, and I'm almost 20 now. Up until a year ago, it helped A LOT. I suddenly got good grades, more social, and felt great about myself. This past year, I noticed it wasn't giving me the same awesome effects. So, I started taking half of one extra, for that extra boost. Half of one became 4. Yes, I was taking 7 to 8 a day. This went on for about 9 months. My seasonal depression turned into major depressive disorder and I'm diagnosed with general anxiety disorder, chronic insomnia, major depression, mild schizophrenia, and amphetamine psychosis. Moral of my story: If you enjoy becoming addicted to a drug, seeing and hearing stuff, paranoid, depressed, aggressive, and losing everyone close to you, go for it. For everyone else, DO NOT TRY/USE ADDERALL!!! And if you do, for god's sake, DO NOT ABUSE IT! YOU'LL BECOME MENTALLY CRAZY.
1094$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/28/2012 1:01:43 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$5$5$I was diagnosed with ADD (not ADHD) in early August 2012 when I finally decided to get checked out for it
column2: and I'm taking 10mg twice daily. The pros: I am now less ""socially awkward""
column3: I'm more motivated and concentrated
column4: it boosts my mood (which is a HUGE plus considering I have chronic depression)
column5: I feel confident in my abilities to do things
column6: and I enjoy things I once never enjoyed
column7: which was just about everything. The cons: weight loss (I don't realize I'm not eating because it depletes your appetite)
column8: strange ""crawling""/ itching sensation when I begin to come down from it at night (anyone else with this sensation? It's not listed anywhere as far as side effects go)
column9: almost impossible to fall asleep at night if I take it too late in the day.

column1: Although the cons may seem like more than the pros
column2: the cons are very tolerable and can be relieves such as taking a non habit forming sleep aid (Zzzquil works great!) and if you absolutely aren't hungry while taking it
column3: drink an ensure shake once a day or take vitamins daily to ensure you don't become malnourished
column4: (butter pecan flavored ensure tastes pretty good). It also has a habit of causing your body to develop a tolerance
column5: so if you want to avoid taking massive doses in the future
column6: I recommend going a day or two (or three!) without taking it. Specifically on days where you don't have to accomplish anything. This (should) help prevent developing a tolerance and make sure that you get the full effect. Overall
column7: I am very
column8: VERY happy with this medication."

column1: 1108$Condition: Other$8/15/2012 12:07:03 AM$Reviewer: kissmissrabbit
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$4$4$I had been diagnosed multiple times with manic depression
column3: anxiety
column4: psychosis etc etc
column5: and yet none of the medications seemed to help me overall with my mood and motivation. Then recently after being diagnosed with fibromyalgia
column6: I was referred to a psychologist for ADD testing which can be affiliated with fibromyalgia. I was then diagnosed with ADD and was put on 10 mg of adderall twice daily. It has done absolute wonders for me. Taking it early enough in the morning and once again around noon keeps me from being up too late. My mood is always heightened and I am very motivated and not overwhelmed. The only downfall is that of a rare side effect
column7: which would be once the adderall starts to wear off
column8: I get the sensation of bugs crawling all over my skin. It scared me at first because my first impression was that it could be bed bugs or scabies
column9: but after both were ruled out
column10: I learned it is a rare and unspoken side effect of this drug
column11: which has been controlled by a low dosage of atarax
column12: which is an antihistamine primarily. and the nice thing about it is that it helps me sleep at night! Anyone else seem to have that bizarre sensation once it gets later in the day and the adderall is wearing off?

column1: 1110$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/10/2012 12:50:58 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I've been taking Adderall for about 8yrs now and there's good news and bad news. Good news is that it works wonderfully in managing the symptoms. The bad news is that you have to watch how your appetite is affecting your eating habits
column2: usually you won't be hungry until the medicine wears off and you might find yourself malnourished if you're not careful. Also note that you can develop permanent 'tics' or compulsive repetitive behaviors. I have developed a tic of chewing on the side of my tongue. I am now pregnant and cannot take the medication for obvious reasons and yet I still chew on my tongue
column3: but that being said
column4: it isn't severe enough to prevent me from retaking it after my pregnancy because the ADHD is definitely worse than the side-effects of the Adderall. However
column5: every person is different so maybe for other people these 'tics' and appetite changes might not seem so minor. Overall though I have found it very useful and it has made a huge and mostly positive difference in my life
column6: so if you're thinking about trying it to treat your ADHD then I'd say go right ahead.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I've been taking Adderall since I was in 3rd grade for treatment for my ADHD. I am now a junior in high school and still take it daily for school. When I started taking Adderall it was the 5mg IR before school every day. A very low dosage for an 8 year old but it did help. Since then I changed to 10 mg ER somewhere in later middle school when I was either 13 or 14. Just this year I increased to 20 mg ER before school with 10 mg IR after school in order to help focus on homework. The adderall has been invaluable for me in helping me focus both during school and out

1186$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/12/2012 1:14:38 PM$Reviewer: BreezieBoo, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$To begin, I've never had an issue with addiction or drug abuse. I'm a college senior with a GPA of 3.6. I LOVE my classes and professors, but I can't pay attention as well as I wished. I found myself drinking insane amounts of coffee just to try and stay focused. I couldn't get through more than 4 pages in a book without having to reread it again. The worst part was, I had absolutely no motivation to do any schoolwork away from school (which used to not be a problem at all.) So, a few weeks ago, a classmate told me she was prescribed Adderall for the last 14 years, but stopped taking it, and selling it to make a quick buck. I had already researched ADD and ADHD and self diagnosed myself. I cut a 20mg pill in half, and didn't feel any difference at all. I waited a day or 2 and tried a full 20mg dose. 30 minutes later or so, I then found myself reading normally again, I was motivated to do things I had put off for weeks, I didn't get bored doing normal everyday things, and I didn't feel like I was moving at a million miles a minute (like I read people felt earlier.) I don't know when or if it even stopped working. I took it around 7pm and went to bed, no problem, at midnight (my typical bedtime) without any issues. I know that I don't HAVE to take it every day at all, but my days off when I want to just sleep and be lazy, I take  just ONE 20mg pill around noon after I have been up for a few hours, and I am far more productive than I have ever been in years. I'm not sure how to go about talking to a doctor about my self-diagnosis, or if there are any other similar medicines that could possibly be prescribed without the overly judged and criticized name Adderall attached to it. Not sure if that helps anyone, but I do see a positive change definitely. I wouldn't use it habitually or for an extended amount of time. 
1187$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/10/2012 9:04:53 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$This helped me increase my focus and concentration tremendously... I once was at a standstill in College, always wanting class to be over, never paying attention, ditracted and over stimulated by the smallest noises; I would find myself obsessing about the tapping of a pencil, rather than the professor. As a result, my grades suffered, self-esteem suffered,  and I wanted to give up. I was prescribed adderall xr my sophomore year in College and I literally noticed a dramatic difference immediately. My grades went from a 2.4 and have remained at a 3.6. I do not recommend for long term use.

column1: 1213$Condition: Other$1/8/2012 12:00:20 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$"I knew growing up that i had a problem with focusing & motivation for anything. i caused trouble in school to make the days more exciting or i would count repeatedly in my head & obsess on objects
column2: instead of paying attention. (i also suffer from diagnosed OCD)after high school
column3: i found myself breaking up my family & the life we had going for us
column4: just so i could live my life on the edge with alcohol
column5: pills
column6: & sex. all because i was bored with life & i needed the adrenaline rush to stimulate my mind & body. i was officially diagnosed with ADD without hyperactivity at the age of 23 & started off with Ritalin
column7: which didn't even touch my ADD. i'm finally taking what i wanted all along.. Adderall. i now take 30mg twice a day & it has made all the difference in the world. i can finally focus on tasks at hand
column8: i have the motivation & energy to get things done
column9: and people & things don't irritate me as badly as they did before. side effects? it does give you an addictive ""high"" that's supposedly comparible to cocaine
column10: so i do see the potential for abuse. it causes insomnia for me if taken too late in the day or if i double my dosage
column11: but i can take my next dose that morning & run like i had a full-night's sleep. i was 143lbs when i started taking Adderall (which is the biggest i have EVER been in my life
column12: due to eating for comfort after the death of my sister) but i am now 126lbs after 3-4 months of being on Adderall. i literally have no appetite anymore.. unhealthy & i know this BUT i honestly love seeing my lbs drop. also makes my heart race at times & can be somewhat alarming
column13: especially since my heart rate is on the high side anyways. the major issue i have had (that i haven't seen from other users) is my OCD is worse than ever now. maybe i'm focusing TOO much & that triggers my OCD? other than that
column14: i think the benefits outweigh the side effects. thank you Adderall. sorry for the long story
column15: but i hope my experience helps & someone else can relate :)"

column1: 1216$Condition: Other$12/27/2011 10:52:31 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"I was diagnosed with ADHD at age 28.  I have a history of procrastination
column2: lack of motivation
column3: organized chaos and extreme fatigue/tiredness accompanied by worrying and anxiety.  I was treated for anxiety to start
column4: pristiq.  Once
column5: under control
column6: My doctor started with a low dose of adderrall increased by 5 mg a day until I reached the point where I felt focused
column7: locked in on my work and time seemed to fly by.  I reached 20 mg and maintained for 30 days.  The results where amazing.  I can't believe I went my whole childhood without this diagnoses.  Anyways
column8: upon my evaluation my doctor ""upgraded"" me to vyvanse stating that it has a cleaner smoother release and I should benefit more.  The first day I felt like I was on cocaine.  I had lock jaw
column9: grinding my teeth and felt like i was high which kept coming and going.  I gave it 2 weeks and had to quit.  My doctor switched me back to extended release adderrall and I'm symptom free.  My ADHD is under control and I'm functioning much better at work and home.  Eating was one of my coping mechanisms before so the decreased appetite was a welcome.  To combat
column10: I keep lots of fruit
column11: yogurt
column12: veggies and nuts on hand.  My general physician introduced me to a book called ""Driven to Distraction"" which helped me understand my condition
column13: the different variations
column14: as well as ways to combat.  For me
column15: exercise and to do lists are my keys to success.  Recently
column16: I tried stopping pristiq to see if my anxiety was just a result of the ADHD but found I have a combination condition.  I wouldn't have understood this without reading the book so I highly recommend in addition to adderrall xr. "

1236$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/2/2011 2:49:01 PM$Reviewer: Towlie, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$3$2$Here is the issue. ADHD Im diagnosed with by some phychiatrist. Other phychiatrist i have been evaluated by say i don't have it. They all have MD after there names so who is correct and who's incorrect??...I've been off and on adderall for 8 years. Im 28 years old. Yes it helps me concentrate. Yes, it helps motivate me. Yes, it even makes me feel better about myself...however adderall is extremly addictive, so thats the biggest issue with it. This is a med that is in high demand among society and can kill if it falls into the wrong persons hands. Drug users feel great euphoria and energy when they use it, simply put; thats why they use it. Prescription drug abuse is sky rocketing like never before. So parents keep that in mind.---SO-- The fact remains adderall helps a ton with certain people. If you plan to take it here are a few tips (not that im a dr.) 1)If you have a prior substance abuse problem, FORGET adderall 2)Take it exactly how directed by MD. 3)Keep it in a place thats secure, kids know ALL about adderall. 4)Keep an eye on your pulse, BP, and heart rate. The worst side effect i've expericed is becoming anxious on it. I am just trying to give a down to earth review, and i hope it helps some of you.

1239$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/30/2011 1:23:38 PM$Reviewer: rngr9782, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$3$I get mixed feelings when it comes to Adderall. I'm a 25 y/o male that was diagnosed with ADHD 3 years ago. I took adderall (30mg
column2: 2x day) for the first 2 years and it worked well for the most part; there were two problems though. For one
column3: if you forget to take your second dose when you're supposed to
column4: you're going to notice...at least I did. Secondly
column5: god-forbid I took my morning dose on an empty stomach; I'd feel really jittery and my mind would race at 100mph. Overall though
column6: it did it's job. I ended up switching doctors at the VA (I'm a vet) and my new doc mentioned dexedrine. I was reluctant to try them
column7: but he put on me on 2x10mg spansules in the morning and 2x10mg tabs in the afternoon. Here I am a year later a lot happier with the results. The onset is smoother
column8: it's easier to eat on it and there are no ups-and-downs. I recommend looking into dexedrine for anyone who runs into these problems with adderall...Also
column9: dexedrine is a lot cheaper than adderall. Generic 10mg IR tabs cost about $.27 each
column10: while the 10mg spansules are 2.16each."

It works well and I love it. Unfortunately, I love it so much I take well over the recommended daily dose. I have built my tolerance up to 350mg per day, and it makes me feel awesome. About a half hour after I pop them, my heart will start pounding and hurt incredibly. Often, when remaining still, my legs or arms will go numb. I feel dizzy and weak all the time. I will also get severe chest pain and back aches. I do not sleep, and if I do, I sleep at the most one hour during the day. Concerning eating habits, I don't eat much and have lost a lot of weight. My withdrawals are hell, and unexplainably miserable. I feel sad, tired, hungry, bored, and hopeless. I will admit that these pills possess most of my thoughts. If I don't have multiple pills on me at all times, I feel very uncomfortable. Therefore, I at least need to have pills on me for the next time I need to take some.

column19: loving

My final words would be do not be afraid to ask questions
column21: investigate
column22: get second opinions and never have blind allegiance to one doctor. We all make mistakes and are not perfect for we are truly

You can only use it as a loose guideline for your own personal situation and physical makeup. column1: 1309$Condition: Other$9/6/2011 1:57:19 PM$Reviewer: FlyByTurkey
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"Where to begin... I decided to start seeing a therapist when my anger and irritability issues were having an impact on everyone around me including my children and my girlfriend and her daughter. I have always had these issues but I can also be a very fun person too. After a few visits with the therapist and asking her for help with the anger among other issues including concentration. She gave me a test for ADD and failed miserably. Went to the Dr. and he prescribed 20mg Prozac a day and 10mg of Adderall twice daily. WOW! Slap in the face and one happy son of a gun. For a week it was weird because of adjusting to the meds. Not much sleep and felt foggy and strange but that went away. After a couple of weeks I upped the Prozac to 40mg a day. Worked a lot better for me (28 year old male 215lbs).  I tried not taking the Adderall on the weekends but I just got distant and irritable. I thought it was the Prozac so I tried stopping it and just taking Adderall. Nope
column3: that didn't work. I got easily car sick and real irritable. So just went back on both at the same time until I could talk to my Dr. about switching or something. I decided to try upping the Adderall by splitting on in half and taking 15mg in the morning and 5mg later in the day. I felt a lot better on a higher dose. I decided to save up a few extras and try to take 20mg in the morning and 20mg later in the day. WOW! That is a lot different feeling. I can really concentrate now and I actually get up and do things and finish them instead of just wanting to but can't seem to just do it. My girlfriend (now my wife) is loving it. I taught her daughter how to ride a bike
column4: cleaned up the garage and organized it (which has been a dump for a long time) and I cleaned up my office (boss has been on my butt for a while). Best part is
column5: I love that I am a person now. Cure for depression and anxiety: antidepressant + Adderall. Antidepressant to numb the pain and

column1: Adderall to get your butt up and enjoy life!"

column1: 1336$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/31/2011 12:21:17 PM$Reviewer: Eiheiken
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"This medication has helped my ADD tremendously especially in the work place. Some side effects though more so from coming off of it when I take drug holidays they are usually spent sleeping on the couch. When I take it though I do very well and usually by the end of the day sleeping is not a problem. However it used to be a problem when I took the XR version. Now I take the plain old fashion immediate release tablets 30mg at a time. Once in the morning and then in the afternoon or I break my afternoon in half to make an additional 15mg available to take closer to 4:00pm but no later that a way I can stretch it out if its a longer day. At this dosage/prescription I don't suffer from insomnia as the drug tends to wear off my quickly at the end of the day and then I can sleep. Some side effects like feeling speedy and shaky can happen but are usually mild if not somewhat pleasant anyhow. I've been taking this dosage for years and I still say there is an advantage to having ADD. One is being able to take Adderall as I can usually run circles around my co-workers. When I'm on my medicine its like my personality lights up a little more and I stay focused and on task with little negative side effects. After so many years my body is addicted to it though hence the major withdrawal I go through on the couch on drug holidays. But if you don't mind being lazy and sleepy during those time I think it is well worth it all. Adderall is 4 amphetamine salts in one tablet so its like the inventors of this drug just said to themselves ""well one of these stimulants has to hit the right spot"" and then they marketed it with the clever name ADD ERALL. So for what ever reason it does work well for ADD. The only other drug I haven't tried for ADD is Desoxyn (methamphetamine) I guess I have been afraid to even ask for it just by the stigma that goes along with the name. So my experience with these drugs is well worth mentioning if you want an honest and thorough review.   "

column1: 1353$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/4/2011 8:13:02 PM$Reviewer: Nick
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$4$"I am on Adderal XR. I began with 20 mgs and that worked for about three months. During this time I did not suffer from any side effects.But
column3: I began to feel ""out of it"" again and found myself struggling to focus and being overwhelmed with all my tasks. I also (again) had problems with impulsiveness and not being able to ""think clearly"". I asked my doctor for an increase and he then prescribed 30 mgs a day. It did help. I also discovered that the generic did not work for me. I am experiencing dry mouth as a side effect. With the medication I've estimated that it has decreased my impulsivity by 85%. I believe it has taken a years time and a bit more for me to see the maximum effect of the medication. It's as though my brain needed that much time to get ""soaked"" by the Adderall XR. I am now in the place where I am now starting to deal with developing good habits to overcome my great disorganization. I am trying to strengthen my ability to think linearly.  When I first started the medication (at 20 mgs and again at 30 mgs) I found disorganization unsettling and I became neater for a time.  I then again became sloppy and I was bothered by the fact that the sloppiness didn't seem to bother me. Over all I'm happy with the medication."

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$"I'm a college student majoring in electrical engineering and I was diagnosed with adhd when I was 12 years old: i was one angry and hyper kid! Anyways I was perscribed to Strattera as I entered middle school beginning with 20 mg. After seven years this medication was working miracles with a few ups and downs here and there... well that's the good part.

column1: The bad news is the positive effects literally ""shut off"" in a matter of two weeks this past winter. I was back to that child who could barely read a couple of pages in a book
column2: let alone prepare for exams and papers as a college freshman. It was terrible: I lost great relationships with friends and family
column3: suffered from depression and constant unpredictable mood swings
column4: and the list goes on and on. Even with an increase in 80 mg the pills were useless unless two or more were consumed a day.

column1: I talked to my doctor about the problem and he said drastic neurochemical changes may have built a tolerance against the strattera
column2: which is farely common with that particular drug. To compensate
column3: he perscribed 20 mg of Adderall to take with 100 mg of Strattera a day
column4: and let me tell you
column5: the waters have settled and the sun shines again! Complete clarity and focus
column6: anxiety almost nonexistent
column7: and I feel back to my normal self. Only thing is that my appetite has diminished quite a bit and I have the libido of a neutered camel
column8: but those don't outweigh the fact that life is GREAT again. I could see where an addiction could transpire because it's pretty much altered cocaine that's approved by the fda
column9: but really it all comes down to you: ""can I survive w/o downing 16 pills today?"""

column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$3$I was about 12 years old or so when I started taking Adderall. People said they noticed an immediate difference- my grades improved
column3: I started paying attention

column7: which continue to plague me to this day. At the time
column8: I was battling ADD
column9: depression
column10: anxiety... you name it. The stomach issues were just another thing to add to the list. By age 15
column11: I had an endoscopy
column12: and it discovered I had a condition known as Eosinaphililic Esophagitis (I think that's how it's spelled) as well as an ulcer. I continued taking medicine to treat everything
column13: until I had the idea to just stop taking my medicine altogether. That was at age 16. For more than a year and a half
column14: I experienced NO pain whatsoever from my stomach
column15: my depression faded
column16: and I was still able to focus as well as I was able to on the drug. I haven't taken it since
column17: as I haven't felt a need to

column19: and kept me in a state of perpetual pain. But I was always alert and focused
column20: so technically
column21: the pill did its job. I don't see how everyone says this pill is addictive
column22: I find it far from that. During the time I was taking the medicine
column23: I continued to gain weight until I was nearly 300 pounds. Now
column24: it's been almost 2 years since I've taken them
column25: and the weight melted off naturally
column26: I'm down to 175- lighter than I've been in years. I feel better
column27: and I still can focus as well as I could on the drug
column28: despite not taking it. All in all

column30: but it surely gets the job done if you don't mind the agony...

column1: 1403$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/22/2011 11:44:05 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$1$3$"Whether or not you have ""ADD"" adderall will help you concentrate
column2: get things done
column3: be more efficient etc.. Im a Senior in college.. 95% of people use it to study. If your kid says this isn't true.. they are lying.. or a freshman.. or from Idaho. I was tested and given 20mg pills... at first it was amazing. Not only could I sit down studying for my exams for 10 hours straight (literally) but it felt fun to study. Class was all of a sudden so interesting. Loooong story short
column4: after a few months of using it off an on (about 3 pills a week) the effects changed. Yes
column5: I could concentrate better when I was alone studying/doing school work. However
column6: when taking adderall I felt like some kind of zombie. Like.. I couldn't smile couldn't laugh
column7: didn't want to talk to anyone..(Im usually very extroverted). The day after taking adderall I sleep until about 2 or 3 pm. Ew! Typically I wake up at 7am and cannot sleep past 9 am! Once you start using the drug it is hard to get off it. Example: I am not physically dependent but when HUGE exams come along I mentally feel like I NEEED adderall. And yes
column8: I use it. (Stopping after graduation in a week). The mind is a powerful thing. Once you get off the drug
column9: once simple tasks may seem laborious. Final point:: I wish I never tried it. Also... I agree with a comment right below.. it is so sad that children are given this drug. Crazy. Try changing their diet.. brain teasers.. holistic options! Im a psychology major and we were just learning how on a basic-level naturalists perspective.. kids are not supposed to have great concentration because its a time to explore as much as they can as their highly plastic brains develop. Soak it all in! Helloooo people
column10: what elementary kid do you see sitting still & silent focusing on their workbook 24/7? Little adderrall robot antisocial children? Oh yea.. in all of my neuroscience courses we learned the chemical properties of the drug. Very similar to speed.. and cocaine. "

column16: if this is an underlying problem you already have. Has been helpful for ADD symptoms
column17: but I've also realized it is not a magic cure
column18: and cannot stress enough the importance of being proactive in terms of learning your individual weaknesses and trying different ways to help overcome them.  WebMD has been helpful
column19: along with www.ADDitude.com and www.ThriveWithADD.com.  Would love to meet with a psychotherapist that specializes in ADD
column20: but haven't been able to find such a thing.  A life coach specializing in ADD would also be great
column21: but unfortunately is not covered by insurance and seems to be quite costly.  Overall has been helpful for me
column22: but do believe that everyone is affected differently.  Good luck!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$3$5$I am 40 yrs. old and have been on Adderall 20 mg 2x a day for 2 yrs. now. I am also on a BP med and Effexor XR.  All taken together have proven just how productive I am at completing tasks at work.  Although I have found that there is an interaction when I take the Adderall and Effexor together
column3: so now I allow at least 2 hrs. after taking Adderall before taking Effexor. The great thing is I have always been able to sleep really well.  After trial and error with other ADD meds found this to be most effective.  However at 3:30-4:00 pm in the afternoon it wears off.  I don't reallty know what to do with myself
column4: feel like I need a small dose to keep up with things I have to attend after work
column5: errands
column6: and in social settings. I am lucky to have a doctor who shares a real concern about the side effects in it increasing my heart rate.  She has already referred me to a cardiologist only to find that Adderall in combination with the other 2 meds raises my heart rate some.  Enough for her to put me on BP med taken everyday.  Sure there are some mild side effects of being tired but but there could be dangers in increasing the size of my heart down the road.  So the risks outweigh the mild side effects.  Just now need to bring to Dr's attention that I might need something for focus early evening.  Anybody out there who needs to take a small dosage of Adderall? Any suggestions?

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$1$4$"I took this drug from 2001 through 2010 and unfortunately never realized that this drug was the cause of intense calf pain and horrible circulation in my legs and hands. My feet used to literally turn blue. My legs in general were always bluish. I went to dozens of doctors over the past decade for a diagnosis. I even proactively asked the doctors if adderral could be causing the awful calf pain (which was the result of such poor circulation). The doctors all told me ""no"". FINALLY
column3: I found an incredible doctor who researched my pain extensively and told me that adderral may indeed be the cause of the freezing cold hands and feet
column4: as well as awful pain in my legs. Adderral is AWFUL to get off of. VERY DIFFICULT. I'm now off adderral and my pain is 90% better and I no longer have blue hands and feet. This drug can work wonders...but it has the potential to cause many health problems. "

column1: 1443$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/7/2011 11:15:08 PM$Reviewer: Lionheart
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$4$"This medication has its pros and cons. I've never been able to focus on anything for more than 30 minutes at most
column3: especially with work and school. It took a while to figure out what worked for me
column4: but due to insomnia I use the instant release tablets since they wear off by the end of the day. I take 15 to 30 mg per day and it works wonderfully. I feel like I can actually function like ""normal"" people. The downside is that this is a stimulant so it will wake you up and makes sleeping difficult. It also causes a loss of appetite
column5: which can be rather difficult to deal with. After taking a dose
column6: it becomes nearly impossible to eat. Even forcing food down with liquids is a chore. It's as if food has no appeal or satisfying taste. Another negative side-effect of the instant release tablets is the comedown. Since this is a stimulant similar to speed/cocaine/meth
column7: it can have an intense comedown. I become very easily agitated (little things will set me off)
column8: I get headaches
column9: and I overall just feel sick. This is more intense if you haven't been eating throughout the day and if your taking a higher dose. Being aware of how crappy the comedown is makes it easier to deal with. I now can control my mood very well during my comedown and it now rarely affects me. I am not recommending this since it is an illegal solution (unless you have a medical prescription)
column10: but ""herbal"" use has been extremely helpful with the side-effects. Once my day is over and my comedown is beginning to make me feel sick
column11: a little greenery goes a long way. It removes all the negative moods and headaches
column12: restores my appetite
column13: and helps me fall asleep. I can not believe such a helpful drug is illegal
column14: because I would be (more) underweight and sick without it. It's what works for me and my prescribing psychiatrist is aware of my use
column15: but I'm not here to preach about it.

column1: Basically
column2: Adderall side-effects can be ROUGH
column3: but without it I could never manage to work 8 hour days or sit through night class."

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$3$5$"I have higher than normal blood pressure
column3: so I stopped smoking and reduced my caffeine intake before asking my doctor about it.  I would have been considered a light ""on and off"" smoker; probably 3-5 per day for a few months
column4: then I'd stop for a few months
column5: and repeat.

column1: Two weeks afterward
column2: I decided to go out a few nights and had a few cigs at the bar.  The next day when I took my Adderall
column3: I had an immediate urge to smoke.  It was to the point that I wanted to smoke up to a whole pack in a day.

column1: Being as it's a stimulant
column2: it definitely helped me focus on schoolwork.  I've been on a number of psychiatric meds
column3: most of which killed off my libido and led to sexual dysfunction.  My libido went sky high
column4: but it destroyed my ability to perform.  I'm sure it was caused by the Adderall in addition to smoking because I checked my blood pressure about a month later and it spiked to 165/80.

column1: I also have seasonal depression
column2: and during this period the Adderall made me irritable.  Eventually
column3: the depression killed off the effects of Adderall.  I just started an antidepressant
column4: so hopefully this will correct it.

column1: Be very careful if you have high blood pressure
column2: smoke
column3: or consume excessive amounts of caffeine.  If you anxiety
column4: depression
column5: or bipolar disorder
column6: as I do
column7: you may have better results with the Adderall in treating ADHD."

1457$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/16/2011 5:20:20 PM$Reviewer: Shyboi30
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$2$1$I'm a 30 year old white male who is a recovering addict from meth. I'm diagnosed with ADD w\o Hyperactivity. My life has been a stuggle. I lived with this disorder untreated for most of my life. this is how I found my way to meth addiction before I found out my real problem.  I want everyone to know that this medication is nothing like meth. A lot of people say that it is and a lot of people believe that it is. Let me
column3: being someone who has experienced both. Tell you that it is not at all the same.  To be honest with you I wish that it was. Do not think that in anyway I'm trying to say that meth is a good drug in anyway. What I'm saying is
column4: is that meth for people with ADD is a form of self medication and its addicting to us because we become normal people. I had high hopes that this medication would have some of the positive results that meth offers and none of the negative attributes of that drug.  I'm pretty sure I can tell you why this medication is addictive to people though. I've been on a lot of different medications and have learned well how to evaluate their effect on my life. This medication is the most difficult to figure out dosage and the most inconsistent medication I have ever dealt with. This medication can be addicting for us because we are tired of living our lives with ADD. When you take the medication and get varied and inconsistent results you want positive results so you take more to try to find that place where it helps you and remains effective. Its not a medication that you can just take the dosage when your supposed to and it will do what its supposed to. So far I'm not pleased with adderall. I will probably ask my doctor for something else on my next visit and pray that something else will work better for me. I know that this medication helps some people and I really wish that I was getting those kind of results. It would be nice to be able to speak with other people taking this medication and see what their experience has been like.

column3: and it is very addictive.  It really helps me like the hour after i take it and after that i feel tired and disinterested and not in a real good mood. This stuff did calm me down to some extent but I became a whole different person when I was on this and it changed my personality and that was not a good thing.  My grades in school did greatly improve on this stuff.  And it does work immediatly when I take it.  I also noticed though when I took this it made me focus but made me focus on things I shouldn't be focused on.  This makes you feel awake when you first take it then like right after lunch time you feel completly ezhausted and you can't focus on anything
column4: plus i would get headaches every day.  This stuff did temperaily put you in a real good mood like 15 min after you take it then all the sudden you were in a bad mood.  This stuff works great for like a couple years
column5: then after a while you feel addicted to this drug and like it consumes your life.  There are too many ups and downs with this and a different moods every hour.  And without this drug I am not a moodie guy at all.  So I would not reccomend this stuff at all.  This stuff will mess you up.  Try Ritlen I took it for a while it seemed a bit better.
