column1: 1478$Condition: Other$1/21/2011 9:50:00 PM$Reviewer: $2$1$1$CAUTION: THIS MED CAN BE VERY DANGEROUS!!! Being in the medical industry and a user of adderall for nearly a year. Few significant things need to be said. While it did help me focus
column2: I also ended up in the emergency room with a 194/126 BLOOD PRESSURE. Muscle twitches were rampant. Horrific negative moods with sometimes uncontrolled verbal aggression are commonplace (within myself and patients I tend to). Sleeplessness goes without saying especially with XR (extended release). I also experienced confusion and dizziness (also reported by many patients). It causes excessive urination as well which tends to deplete your potassium (which helps maintain normal heart rhythms). Eat a banana. Dehydration is a bad side effect so drink plenty of water as well. You have to ask yourself...is focus and production increase worth the risk?

I got alot of help from the teachers they would read my test to me so i could hear it and see it at the same time. I know now that i would of got better grades and not suffered so much if my parents would of not jugded everything by what they hear on the news about kids beating up kids for retalin on the bus. I have always loved to make people smile with the dorky little things and sound effects i make just for fun and i know you make awesome sound effects to if you have the same prob:) I have not lost my wonderful personality. column1: 1492$Condition: Other$1/8/2011 4:51:25 PM$Reviewer: pikachukiller84
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$3$5$"Hi
column3: I have never been diagnosed with anything or taken any medications until just recently. I am a 26 year old make and have been feeling very down for almost a year to the point of wishing to die everyday. I have always felt it even as a child
column4: but recently decided to seek help. The doctor prescribed me Celexa 20mg at first
column5: I took it for a couple weeks and really didnt notice anything. He upped it to 40mg/day (Celexa) and after about a month on it I started to notice a change. It happens pretty slow
column6: and it is subtle. But now I am much happier
column7: I can talk to my family now without getting an attitude
column8: and I have an overall feeling of ""life is good"". The only thing negative I noticed about it was sometimes I would feel zoned out
column9: or staring off into space. So the doctor prescribed me Adderall 10mg twice a day. I have only been taking the adderrall for about 4 days but let me tell you... this drug can work for you or against you. The first day I got it
column10: I didnt take it early enough and was up all night. The second day I took it in the morning
column11: and then in the afternoon. The first time taking it the feeling was intense. One pill makes you not feel much
column12: but after the second one you get euphoria that last's for about an hour or two and you have the feeling of being on coke or something. I was unclear for a couple of days how to use it because I didnt really feel like I could concentrate. So today I reduced it to one just before I took my test and found it to be ok. It isnt what I thought
column13: I know it would work better if I took the second dose
column14: but i didnt want to seem wired today
column15: and I wanted to get a goodnight sleep. As far as mood goes
column16: the Adderall put me in a really good mood
column17: non aggressive
column18: and also very relaxed (even though I felt wired and cracked out). I want to know what I should do
column19: because 1 dose in the morning is ok
column20: but the second one really enhances the situation
column21: clears my head up and allows me to concentrate
column22: but like I said the feeling for a few hour"

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"This treatment is the best thing that has ever happened to me....I was diagnosed with ADHD when I was a little kid. At the time my mother refused to put me on medication because she feared I would be put into special ed classes. I hated school
column3: with a passion. I was bored with what I was being taught
column4: and focusing on doing homework was impossible. After dropping out of high school
column5: and moving to a different state
column6: I got my GED and started college. I talked to my doctor about my problems in the past with ADHD and she started me out on Concerta
column7: which didn't do anything at all. She then switched me to Adderall XR 20mg once a day. For me this medicine is an absolute miracle. I can't believe the difference it has made in my ability to focus
column8: not only on school
column9: but living life in general.

column1: This drug definitely does not work for everyone. I have read a lot of reviews about children having negative reactions. A close friend of mine's son was taking 30mg a day at the age of 12. He also has MANY other psychological problems as well
column2: and Adderall turned him into a monster. His rage towards everyone around him was unbelievable. When he stopped taking it his behavior improved tremendously. In my opinion I think doctors are giving kids way too high of a dosage.

column1: Withdrawals from Adderall is a nightmare. I've taken a few breaks from it for about a month at a time within the past few years. I slept at least 16+ hours a day for a week straight. When I wasn't sleeping I was eating. The mood swings were terrible
column2: and I had NO patience for ANYTHING or ANYONE. But after about a week I was almost back to normal.

column1: Adderall sometimes makes me very compulsive.  I will occasionally obsessively pick at my skin
column2: and once I start its really hard to stop. Not many people experience that. Also as a smoker
column3: it makes me smoke A LOT.

column1: I also found that Vitamin C pretty much blocks Adderall from absorbing into the body. Once I stopped drinking juices w/ vit. C
column2: the Adderall worked normall"

column16: and thats a major health concern for my child and family.My homework and health has been put off for so long.I've lived w the anxiety that I will fail at everything I do.I am ready to live a normal

column5: with the PTSD I would not be able to go to sleep at night with racing thoughts about the war or I would go to sleep and wake up in sweating from horrible nightmares. Now it's like I have both going on except I seem to not have the racing thoughts about the war so much

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$"I've been on generic Adderal
column3: 10mg 3x day for three days. I had a sleep study and have a ""fragmented sleep pattern"" but just shy of having narcolepsy. After sleeping for 17 hrs a day for four years
column4: falling asleep while on the computer
column5: watching tv
column6: dozing off while shopping and doing dishes
column7: it's nice to wake up at 10am not 4pm. I was so depressed *because* I couldn't wake up
column8: not because of my depression which is well treated. My psychiatrist didn't care to listen. I'm still getting the timing right so I can sleep well at night. I do take meds for anxiety
column9: seizures
column10: atypical depression
column11: and tremors with muscular contortions. Thought adderal would really agitate all this but all I do is shake a little bit. I drag a lot between doses and my concentration goes away. I feel really physically hungry when I'm hungry
column12: but every food seems repulsive to me. I force myself to eat. I've had really tight muscles
column13: partly because of occasional contortions
column14: partly from adderal plus scoliosis. I do a lot of stretching and see my chiro. My pulse stays at 84 bps
column15: some very brief palpitations (one or two per day) so NO caffeine. I meditate and do breathing exercises. One very weird thing: Night sweats. Otherwise great. I'm awake all day
column16: can concentrate (no memory due to Topomax)
column17: and can do journaling and my art again plus be social. No more haze and I'm enjoying life for the first time in years! "

1635$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/7/2010 4:16:09 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I was first prescribed Adderall XR when I was 16 years old. But in addition to that diagnoses of ADHD I was also told I had Bipolar Disorder. Now that I am in my 20s I have a worry about the long term side effects. Every doctor I have asked assures me that there are no proven negative long term effects of taking this medication for a long period of time.  But I can help but think otherwise. It is an amphetamine after all. Other issues I am concerned about have been the effect it has on me when I stop taking it completely. I am very tired and don't really know what to expect or I'm aware of things that are going on around me but can't really grasp the concepts. I have tried the none Extended Release Adderall and it was very unsatisfactory! BLEH! I would take one in the morning and then one in the afternoon and I had major side effects
column2: tremors
column3: ticks
column4: I kept clenching my jaw and I was very unhappy. I am satisfied with the results and ease of the XR tablets. But I still think about the long term side effects...kind of feel like a lab rat considering every doctor I've asked about them seems to think that I'll be fine...I guess I'll find out
column5: eventually...

column1: 1645$Condition: Other$7/27/2010 10:49:50 AM$Reviewer: Linda
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"**** Adderall helped me get through an intensive graduate school program by allowing me to focus on my reading assignments and projects after a long full day at work. It also elevated my mood. I felt happy that I was managing work and school well. I never abused the dosage and took it on a daily basis with the approval of my doctor for a year and a half until I suffered from a ruptured brain aneurysm. I never had high blood pressure and my EKG was fine before starting the medication. I did notice that my BP had gone up while on the medication but I just attributed that to the extra demands of grad school and a new teaching position. I was one of the Extremely lucky ones to survive the ruptured aneurysm w/o complications. My neurosurgeon said that the rupture could have been brought on by the use of this drug and demanded I immediately stop using it. Because of this I would not recommend it's use by anyone. I'm a teacher and would rather see kids or adults bouncing off the walls or daydreaming away then lying in a coffin.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$2$4$For the lady with is worried about her 29 year old daughters hair falling out.  I am 26 years old and have taken adderall since i was 13.  So pretty much everything that most of the things people are saying they are going through in these reviews
column3: they have already come and gone with me.  But the last is the hair loss with me.  Right now Im going to a dermatologist just to figure out my massive hair loss problem.  I fear I will almost be bald by the end of the year (but mostly because my last dermy was a moron and never even ran tests). My suggestion is get her to a Dr.  Get a blood test or test the scalp tissues.  Thyriod/depression/stress/hormones are easily grouped and can be disguised.  And with this disorder is hard to figure if its just you or could actually be an underlining problem.  I have my other dermys apt tomorrow.  Ill respond when i have a better problem with whats going on with me because i can almost guarantee it might be the same thing.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"Currently I am taking Adderall XR 20mg a day and have been doing for about two weeks now. Three months ago I was initially prescribed 15mg of the XR. I have a more inattentive form of AD/HD and I immediately noticed a difference in my ability to focus and concentrate
column3: especially in school. However
column4: as others have complained I notice it does seem to wear off a bit. It's possible I need a higher dosage for more effectiveness but I noticed I have begun jaw clenching and my dry mouth is insane! Although it's possible the dry mouth is from my Depakote. I have a Mixed Bipolar co-morbid AD/HD diagnosis. This medication is overall quite effective and can make a life changing improvement for some. However I want to caution this medication shouldn't make a person with true  AD/HD feel ""tweaked out""
column5: sped up
column6: or high. It should just elevate awareness
column7: focus
column8: and an overall attention to detail. That's why I agree that it is safe for kids truly suffering from this diagnosis should take a stimulant medication such as Adderall. You will notice immediately if these medications will be a right fit for you.   "

column6: adderall and meth are soooooo much alike. I encourage anyone out there to really think twice before putting your child on adderall. First I would get a second apinion from a Dr. who knows about addiction.2nd I would look at the families addiction history. If you must put your child on adderall I would only do so as a last option where you have tried everything else. I do not mean other drugs I mean like counseling
column7: tuitering
column8: sitting down with your child and helping him or her with homework. I mean really try to find out why they are having trouble focusing and try to solve the problem without a drug. Doctors are just so to quick to give you a drug or to put a lable on you. I can talk to 9 out of 10 head Dr.'s and in 15 minutes I can have them lable me anything I want them to and that is sad.I honestly believe most of life's problems are in a persons heart not our head.Please talk to your pastor as well. I think that is the first place I would start. Im talking to the man in the mirrior more than anyone and I pray someone out there knows exactly what Im saying and it's time for this great country to get back to place where we can get our hearts right with God and repent for all our sin and I truly believe our world would be a better place. If anyone out there is addicted to adderall you can get help at a place called the rolloff homes. please go to pbc-roloffhomes.org you and /or your child can get real help. no ins.needed.no money

column1: 1700$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/5/2010 12:48:55 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I have struggled with ADHD symptoms since I can remember.  I only recently started taking medications as my symptoms got worse after having children.  I tried Ritalin before switching to Adderall.  It has helped me more than anything I have ever tried to do on my own (making schedules
column2: writing notes & reminders
column3: not taking on too many things at once).  It just made life so much easier.  I don't have accidents at work
column4: I focus better
column5: I finish what I start and dont procrastinate.  I also am able to get to work on time and not be as stressed and irritable.  However
column6: I have been on it for two years and I have had issues with not being able to take it for a few days or a week sometimes and I definitly felt that there was a dependence even after taking the correct dosage always.  I dont like the fact that Adderall is so addictive whether you abuse it or not.  I want to be put on something else so I dont have to worry about that
column7: but i think that the outcome outweighs the risk...unless another medication can do the same job without being as addictive physically.

column1: 1701$Condition: Other$6/4/2010 9:13:34 PM$Reviewer: Bill Mc
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"Male
column3: Age 60
column4: for Adult ADD. Taking it approx 18 months. Prescribed generic Adderall 20mg twice daily. Usually split the dose into 10mg 2 or 3 times a day. Skipping dose completely 2 days in a row each week so as to not have to increase the dosage. Works very well for me.  Helps me to focus and accomplish what ever I may be working on. Also more sociable and more tolerant of others. Good for anger management. Spouse notices the difference and supportive of my taking it. Some initial weight loss 5 - 8 lbs but have since regained it.  Just eat at meal times and try more highly seasoned food (easy on the salt).  Also drink more liquids. Best to not take it late in the day unless you plan on being up late. I still sleep at night and usually take a nap in the afternoon. Some people complain about excessive side effects and not liking the results.  Well see your MD and maybe try something else.  As for me
column5: ""it's just what the Doctor ordered"".  Wish I had known about this medication years ago.  It's a real help for me. My results far outweigh any side effects
column6: which I find to be minimal."

column1: 1752$Condition: Other$4/14/2010 6:30:17 AM$Reviewer: paintedacres
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I found out that I was ADD almost two years ago. I never figured in a million years that I was until she described my issues to a (T). I agreed to start taking this drug and in the beginning it was a shocker. I was so amazed how alert and focused I was and wished I would have had this throughout school. I did well in school due to getting beat if I didn't but I could have done a lot better and at least been able to retain the information. As an adult I have found it very hard to keep my impusliveness under control. I have issues with spending. I am not a shopaholic but I buy for other people when I know I shouldn't and I over eat very badly even when I am stuffed. I can't control it. It eats at me until I almost have a panic attack. When I buy things it is always for other people not myself. This drug has helped somewhat with that. It at least makes me think about it first. But while I am doing better with it
column3: it still is not cured. I still struggle with the eating and the buying everyday. At first it helped with the eating quite a bit. Now after a year or so the effect has worn off and I tend to eat more than I did however not as much as it was before. My doctor says that you dont get used to the drug and need to take more. You only do if you misuse it. Well I have not misused and I can tell you it doesn't work like it did and I find myself needing to take 3 to 4 10mg pills (fast acting) when before and even now my script says to take 2. I am scared to go off the med since it is helping in my job and keeping me on track but I am scared to keep on with it and get to where I am abusing. I don't think I ever will however I am getting used to it. I am also scared to take other meds for add since a few times I have changed scripts for depression and it has messed me up.

1793$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/17/2010 1:54:14 PM$Reviewer: 7-12 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $5$5$5$My son is in 4th grade & had extreme difficulties at school such as focus,comprehension,accumulating info, disorganized,not being able to finish the work in class, math, etc. He was also diagnosed a couple of years ago with DAMP. He was on Ritalin for a couple of months 2 yrs ago & stopped since we did not see any improvement. we were at the point of desperation & had enough frustrations & so did he!Therefore eventhough I was very much against drugs we decided that he needs help so let's give it another try! His dr. prescribed Adderall 10mg/day in the AM before breakfast- a miracle has been brought upon my son & our family!! it works wonderful, amazing! the only side affects that I noticed are the loss of appetite (which I am not too upset over since he is about 6 lbs. overweight & noticed that he is hungry in AM, so I give him a healthy breakfast) and sensitivity (he easily cries if someone gets him upset).Other than that there have been no other side affects. we are all extremely happy to see him do extremely well at school. He was never hyper, but had some behavior problems - even that has changed for the better.  He interacts & socialized better w/friends. Prior to this med his grades were Cs and Ds; ever since he started on Adderall the test results are amazing; A's in social studies and B+ in math!!  Not only that it makes everyone happy (his family as well as teachers)that he's doing so well but he is very well aware of it & I can see the happiness that he did not have before when he comes home with good grades & ease at learning!! He has built confidence & holds his head up high!! Thank you Dr. Weidner!!!...& of course Adderall!  I shall return & review this med in a couple of month & let everyone know if he's still doing just as well and/or if the side affects have changed!

column6: my body doesnât respond well to medicine.

column1: Reading comprehension has always been my biggest hurdle
column2: non-technical reading is virtually impossible for me. Just below reading is hanging-in with poor lecturers. I need to have genuine interest in something or my mind will promptly begin to wander. If a teacher shows the end goal and it appears interesting
column3: then the uninteresting stepping stones become interesting
column4: because they are required to get to the concept that you want to know. Conversely
column5: if a teacher presents each building block as something to know
column6: ""because I said so
column7: then I will be staring out the window before they finish their sentence.

column1: Since arriving at the correct dosage
column2: I can now do anything that I want. Not only are my problem areas fixed
column3: but other aspects have improved as well. The best way that I can describe it is having a librarian roaming around in your brain. My capacity for learning has gone off the charts
column4: my memory retention and recollection is ridiculous
column5: and the boost of energy really shines though in self-motivation. And
column6: above all
column7: I now spend at least 2-4 hours per day reading anything that I want.

column1: To put my improvement in context
column2: I took my ACTâs un-medicated. My best score was a 29/36.

column1: Hmm
column2: itâs okay
column3: but look at the pieces:

column1: Math: 36/36
Science Reasoning: 35/36
English: 32/36
Reading: 14/36
I noticed the benefits most
column2: when I lost them with my insurance for a month. Not withdraw symptoms
column3: having to deal with my old flawed brain. I was spoiled.

column1: 1859$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/7/2009 6:31:11 PM$Reviewer: NikiM1973
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Since taking Adderall I consistently do the right things at the right time. Before Adderall I struggled with moments of genius followed by days of a mixture of procrastination and chaos. With Adderall my focusing abilities are quite amazing. I have to actually be careful to not over-focus. I can honestly get so hooked on the details of a particular work project that I find myself working for 12+ hours without much of a break. So with that said I should probably urge everyone to try to maintain a life of balance. I've always been good at what I do
column3: but now I can do more with less. I eat less. I sleep less. I waste time less. I make mistakes less. I'm more patient. I'm overall much happier. Am I addicted to it? Yes. When I don't take it I'm an even bigger disaster than before. If I don't take it I could stay in bed all day and stare at the TV. For me
column4: the Adderall PROS outweight the CONS. If you are a distracted mess with piles of papers

column6: and an inability to put first things first then I suggest you talk with your doctor about trying a low dose for starters. I've been taking Adderall for about 4 years and I take 40 mg daily

column8: so it is not specific to Adderall.

column1: 1887$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/1/2009 9:31:07 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  (Patient) $4$2$3$I am 38 yr old mother of two. My experience is the time release(XR) is the best form the non time release feels like you are on a roller coaster.  The time release is very smooth.  Although I started on 20mg I believe after 5 years on this and now down to 5mg a day this is a very hard drug on my body as a women.  I have two best friends on it and although we love the weight it keeps off and how organized we think we are on it we all believe there is a dark side to this drug that no one talks about. Everyone seems OK in our lives except our husbands.  There is an edgy/anger piece that goes along with this drug..  I think it effects our hormones in some way.  My suggestion is start on a lower dose and move up but I am looking for more natural choices because I think this drug makes life go by very quickly.  I also think as a women you can not help but get addicted to the way you burn more calories and it automaticly suppresses your appetite.  If you are on this and are having relationship problems then you might want to look at this drug as a reason and not other outside things. Also I think if you take the wrong dose it can actually make it harder to complete some things. This drug is in the same family as Meth amphedemines.  If you take this drug you should really think about the similarities to being a junkie!! I stopped taking it for 6 months and gained 30 pounds and I started sleeping a lot and my house became a disaster.  There is probably something better out there
column2: but I have not found it.

1896$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/18/2009 12:05:06 PM$Reviewer: GEElo, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$3$Taking Adderall XR with suboxone makes a pill cocktail. The high from those two drugs combined is a whole new ball game. First of all Docs know nothing but to see you on your appointment and then get rid of you. If they payed any attention they would know that a person with a history of drug or alcohol abuse should not take adderall or adderall xr. But then again they keep us coming back for business. So, would that make them a legal drug dealer. Yes, it would. I had a chemical dependency to perscription painkillers. I realized something was really bad when I was taking them just to be able to function from day to day. I sought help because things were all jacked up. If I could make a difference in someone's life just by writing this little piece then all the pain I caused myself and everyone around me, then I would have to say it was worth it. If you have a chemical dependency the first thing you do is decide weather or not you want to continue that way of life, which is extremely painful. Second, commit to yourself in getting well. You will need a really good support system to help you through it. With hard work and dedication to yourself you will succeed. If you follow those three rules you will get through it with out a dought. If I had to go through it again I would have gone to the psychiatrist to get on suboxone so I could wing myself through it. I was on suboxone for one year exactly. If I would have just listened to my brother and not got on the suboxone I would have gotten over the emotional withdrawl after about 5 to 7 days. The physical withdrawls(tiredness,unmotivated)would eventually pass around three to four weeks. So, you could get through it in a months time verses getting on suboxone and wasting a year of your life.

column1: 1902$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/10/2009 12:44:27 PM$Reviewer: lil'learner
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$I've struggled with ADD my entire life but my parents were totally against medicating me (thank you mom and dad) Instead they made an effort to get me help from tutors and personal coaches that taught me good organizational and study habits which helped a bit. I struggled all through out my 6 years of college and now at 26
column3: moving into the ranks of working for myself and taking on several projects
column4: I could really use some help. My buddy gave me some adderall and I probably got more work done in 2 weeks than my 6 years of college- mainly because I neither ate nor slept for days at time. I also found that I was able to pop these like skittles with frightening ease. I couldn't see taking this medication daily as I wouldn't risk my physical and psychological well-being for any amount of work or money. I believe this should be used as a last resort. One thing I have learned is to observe my work habits while on adderall vs. when I'm not and try to mimic those behaviors daily. This drug is certainly a tool for success but I feel that it shouldn't be used as a way of living.

column1: 1904$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/9/2009 3:20:42 PM$Reviewer: absent_minded
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$"I was started out on 20mg of Adderall Oral daily (in the morning). But currently
column3: my dosage has been increased to 30 mg each morning
column4: with the option to take another 10 to 20 mg later on in the day during long work days. I have an ADHD sufferer's worst nightmare for a job: I'm mostly a paper-pusher/interviewer. I'm a social worker for a corrections department. I have piles of paperwork everyday. I also teach decision-making and social skills classes
column5: which also require a lot of planning and organization. I had been able to negotiate with and compensate for my ADHD all through grade schools
column6: high school
column7: and college. However
column8: my condition became dibillitating at my first ""career"" job with the massive amounts of paperwork and organization I was expected to perform. I'm in my early 20s and began treatment for ADHD at the beginning of August. I feel that the medication has helped me immensely. My family
column9: fiance
column10: and coworkers have all noticed the change in my work habits and all-around behavior. I'm quieter
column11: more focused
column12: and less apt to ""fly off the handle"" for minor things that don't seem to make much sense to anyone else. I'm pretty satisfied overall with my results. That said
column13: I do experience some side effects. I have had pretty significant loss of appetite as well as weight loss. But for me
column14: its not a major issue at the moment as I was already considered somewhat overweight by my doctor when I started the medication. If I continue to lose at this rate
column15: I suppose it could become a problem. I also experience dry mouth pretty badly. I sometimes get it so bad that my whole mouth feels ""fuzzy."" But luckily
column16: I'm allowed to keep a drink on my desk at work :) Also
column17: I occasionally experience headaches that I believe are related to the medication. But these aren't very often. All in all
column18: there's some drawbacks/side effects
column19: but the benefits far outweight them."

column1: 1906$Condition: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day$9/2/2009 12:57:49 AM$Reviewer: Namebadgerequired
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"I was diagnosed with ADD at age 41
column3: and prescribed 20mg 1x/day. It helped a little but not enough to cause me to really follow a treatment track with enthusiasm...typical ADD. Anyway
column4: I am now 46; I have had 4 different employers in that time
column5: plenty of stress
column6: depression
column7: anxiety
column8: low self esteem
column9: etc. Three years ago
column10: I had the double sleep study which revealed that I have narcolepsy. So now
column11: my sleep specialist has me taking 30mg XR in the morning
column12: and Adderall tabs of 20mg at 9am/noon/3pm for a total of 90mg/day. I have gone through highs and lows with this drug - more highs than lows. I think that the biggest drag in this whole process is that Adderall is just a daytime life support system for my exhaustion; it does enable me to focus
column13: hustle
column14: retain instructions
column15: etc. But - I still have an incurable sleep disorder which never allows me to get restorative sleep. I am definitely addicted to Adderall; I get anxious when my doctor goes on vacation because he has done it in the past
column16: without notice! Needless to say
column17: I am changing doctors. Finally
column18: I can relate to people that complain about the zombie effect. I have a great ability to entertain my family and friends with my humor
column19: and sometimes it will just disappear for days. My new doctor said that he is worried about my heart; I told him that I am at peace with ""death by heart attack"". He was not amused. I wasn't trying to be funny
column20: just pragmatic. I need my Adderall and I think it works great for the right patient. "

column1: 1917$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/11/2009 5:54:45 PM$Reviewer: rmhill10
column2: 7-12 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$Adderall has helped me focus so much better and I have went to C's and D's to A's and B's in my grades.  My teachers have actually came up to me and asked if I  was the same person who was in their clas a week ago.  It has helped me get through fourth through sixth grade.  The only problem I have is that it made me want to do evreything at once and that really stressed me out.  I got mild depression becuase of that and I'm now taking an antidepressant AND Adderall.  It's kind of hard to remember to take both the drugs and I somtimes miss a few day on one or both of the drugs.  This drug worked on me but please find out exactly what it does to you before making a comitment to taking it.  Ask your doctor if you can start on the lowest dosage possible and graduly work your way up untill you find a dosage right for you.  Like any other medication it is a hit or miss and you should stop taking it if it worsens your condition or if you have side effects lasting longer than two weeks.  I hope my information helped!

column1: 1921$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/4/2009 1:09:43 PM$Reviewer: TheDoc
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver) $5$5$5$"As a Doctor myself
column3: I have to stress that when it comes to Adderall in either the XR or IR forms
column4: there is no grey area. There are those patients who do extremely well on this medication and others who were perhaps misdiagnosed or physiologically intolerant of the chemical makeup of the drug. The bottom line is: If you need it
column5: it can work wonders. However
column6: if you're one of those who doesn't truly suffer from ADD ADHD-Hyp
column7: then you may gain some benefits
column8: but you will also have more incidence of negative side-effects. My personal experience with the IR has been wonderful. Most everyone has the associated loss of appetite
column9: and general ""fidgety"" feeling when starting treatment
column10: but these do subside. However
column11: they have a nasty habit of resurfacing later on in treatment. This usually accompanies an increase in dosage
column12: but can pop up for seemingly no reason at all. The best advice I can give regarding treatment with amphet salts is: If you need it
column13: then it can help tremendously. However
column14: if you don't need it
column15: you're better off with those awful energy drinks or a few cups of coffee. Hope this helps."

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $1$1$1$"My 18 year old son was recently diagnosed with attention deficite disorder...with no real apparent symptoms.  Our family doctor decided it would help him concentrate in college.  Immediately I noticed that a generally tender-hearted
column3: goodnatured young man became cruel
column4: moody and for lack of a better definition psychotic.  He started abusing alcohol
column5: risky sexual behavior
column6: and would lie about anything.  It was like a alien had taken over my son's body.  It has been a nightmare and I would never encourage any parent to give this drug to their children.  My son has been off of it for about 1 week and right now he is a fragile shell who has suffered with depression
column7: vomiting
column8: headaches etc.  My hope for his once bright future now rests on his ability to overcome an apparent addiction and not to be drawn back down that road.  This is not anything you want to put into your body.  I feel like my only son has been taken from me and I don't know if I will ever get that same bright eyed
column9: enthusiatic young man back.

1937$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/17/2009 7:37:52 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$I am a college student and have been started taking Adderall because I have been on a downward slope academically since my freshman year of high school to now. Although I have had problems with paying attention, getting started with projects, etc., I was able to get by. The work in school, naturally, has become harder. I have been a B/C student for awhile now. For the last month, I have yet receive any assignment that is less than an A. Menatlly, this drug has helped. Physically, not so much. I have noticed that I am more hyperactive. I am constantly fidgeting with my hands and my legs are shake profusely. Also, my eating habits are terrible. I was at a slim 135 pounds to begin with before I began the medication and I know for a fact that I will have lost weight the next time I see my doctor. One side effect is loss of appetite. This effect is extremly noticeable. For me, I very very rarely feel hungry. Just last week I forgot to eat ANYTHING for two straight days. Overall though, if you are careful and responsible this is an effective and easy-to-use drug. Hopefully, this helps.

1953$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/23/2009 5:16:35 PM$Reviewer: Jess, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$5$I've been diagnosed with ADHD since age 6, I am now 26 years old.  I'm overall satisfied with this medication.  I noticed that my mood seems to be more even, I have a better handle on my disorder versus the other medications I've taken, and most of my other symptoms are under control.  I have noticed weight loss but my doctor told me before hand that it would happen. Being that I gained some weight after I stopped my previous medication, I didn't mind that too much.  I have also noticed more dry-mouth than my other medications so I'm drinking a lot more water through the day, but I don't mind that so much as I drink a good amount of water anyway.  One thing that I will have to say is that I keep having to 'readjust.'  My doctor, who I love, started me on an extreme low dose and is working me up to my 'stable' point which has spanned over 8 months now.  Getting to the point of 'stable' is my biggest issue since precautions have to be taken. Due to the nature of this drug, that the risk of addiction is high, my doctor and I are taking it slow.
1954$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/23/2009 4:11:16 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking adderall 20mg once a day and this drug is very affective in treating my ADHD.  I explained that I have a very hard time concentrating.  Whether face to face conversations, reading, or in meetings it was very difficult to give my undivided attention to someone or a group. Additionally, I have struggled for a long time in school, college especially and thought it was just lack of sleep. However, both of my brothers have ADHD and after talking to my doctor about my condition he recommended adderall 20mg.  I was jittery at first (simular to too much caffine) but now Im getting used to it.  I now do not crash everyday after work and no longer need my afternoon nap.  I also can focus on conversations and remeber things much better.  It enables me to be more productive and I can get much more stuff done than before. 1961$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/17/2009 12:08:11 PM$Reviewer: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$3$5$i am a 16 year old. I started taking adderall at the age of twelve. When i was on the drug it was very effective. It helped me concentrate in school, calmed me down from acting out, and helped prevent me from doing bad things. Although it has done good, it has also done bad. For example, i started losing weight because i never had an appetite, i became more distant with people because i was quiet all the time from focusing on things, and i also became needy of it all the time. I have been off of the pills for about a year now and I'm doing just fine. It is extremely hard to get out of the habit of needing them. It takes time to get out of the habit, but eventually it will work. Trust me.  Adderall can be very addictive and although it can benefit you, it may also destroy you in some ways. So one tip to take into consideration if you want to start taking adderall is to start off at a low dosage and work your way up until you feel it is doing its job.

1966$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/8/2009 10:35:36 PM$Reviewer: $3$3$1$I am junior in high school and have been taking adderall for 3 years. At first it seemed like a miracle drug. My grades went up considerably and I felt that I had gained a sense of control. I was prescribed 30mg a day including one 20mg pill of adderall xr. The side effects were harsh in the beginning and I lost a lot of weight. The next 2 years I would take it regularly still having the same side effects but very mild. In short
column2: I could go off the pill and feel fine for any amount of time. But I began to feel a sort of dependence on the drug about a year after. The loss of appetite seemed to be a motivation for me to be thin so i started to up my dose a little bit. My grades went from a 3.3 to a 2.7 and so i figured I was immune to the drug so I started to take even more. For the past about 6 months I have regularly been taking at the least 50mg and at most 70mg a day. Sometimes I don't know why I am taking it I just do. I can honestly say in the past week I have slept in total maybe 10-15 hours some nights not sleeping at all. My heart is constantly pounding and my hands are always shaking. I hate it but i can't help it. My parents dont hide my pills or anything and dont keep track of when they get it so it makes it easy for me.I am always very moody and today I had a nutri grain bar and thats it but I dont even feel hungry. I didnt think drugs prescribed to myself could be so addictive but they are. I suggest people not to take them to begin with.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been taking Adderall since last November (08).  I was started on 20mg of Adderall xr
column3: then went to 25 mg xr

column5: and then an Adderall IR
column6: 10mg
column7: around noon to one p.m.  I think Adderall works great
column8: the problem I had was that even though it is an XR formulation it seemed to wear off around noonish everyday.  I was never able to get ""all day coverage"".  In February my doctor added the 10mg IR ""booster"" and it has worked great ever since.  He told me that every one's body metabolism is different and some get longer coverage than others.  This is what worked for me.  I was worried about sleep issues being on this dose
column9: the amazing thing is I actually feel like I sleep better since being on this medication.  When I lay down to go to sleep I don't have a million and one things floating through my head like I use to.  It's like the background ""white noise"" is gone.  My thoughts are so much clearer now and I can actually get things accomplished instead of 20 things half accomplished.  It's too bad people abuse this drug
column10: it's makes it more difficult for people who use it for legitimate medical purposes to get it.  All of my other medications I can get a 90 day supply in the mail.  With Adderall I have to go to my doctors office every month and pick up my prescription in person.  Other than that absolutely no complaints.  Good luck to all.   "

column2: 45-54 Female  (Patient) $5$5$5$"I am a 49 yr female... I always knew I was differrent. I felt like information went into my brain but went right out the other side. I would read
column3: listen to a lecture or be in a conversation and end with no recollection of the information I was given. How was I to explain this to a doctor... I thought they would think I was crazy. I rehearsed over and over what I would say to them to make them believe there truely was a problem. How much easier it would be to go in and show them a cut
column4: bruise or broken bone... they could fix it. How could they diagnose or fix a problem they couldn't see and I couldn't explain. I spent 7 years in and out of the doctors office. She first put me on prozac
column5: treated me for an inter-ear infection
column6: had me get all of my old fillings replaced
column7: got glasses
column8: treated me for allergies
column9: etc. All these things were good but there was still something much more. She gave up
column10: one day she said ""I can't help you"". Talk about a heart break and a validation that I was crazy. One day I read an ad on Straterra... explaining the symptoms of adult ADHD. I asked my doctor if there were special test for that. She said yes
column11: as she rolled her eyes
column12: but she would have to refer me to a shrink...here we ago again!

column1: The psycologist had me diagnosed in moments. No special tests were needed. The Straterra has helped for about 6 years now but there was still something more that I couldn't put my finger on. I have been going to doctors now for another 3 years to finally get one to take my extreme fatigue seriously. I took a sleep test and I have mild narcolepsy. My doctor has recently added adderall and I am finally content that what I have been silently struggling with all my life has been discovered and properly treated. I breaks my heart to pieces to think I raised my 3 children without this help. I struggled so badly just to make it through each day and hide my feelings of ""stupidness"". Now at almost 50
column2: I feel like I have a clear mind...and a new start on life.   "

1997$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/15/2009 6:05:46 PM$Reviewer: stepford41, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $1$1$3$I have been chronically late most of my life so much so it has cost me jobs. Etc. I also was the kid who just looked out the window in grade school. My psych, decided to give me a test and bam, I have ADD. and was given the generic version. After reading these reviews, I can relate. I have horrible tirade mood swings, I don't feel like I am getting more work done during the day, I focus on things that are not a priority,like ebay. I also leave the office so exhausted I feel like I have lost me. I have no energy to do anything. Errands are a big deal, working out, forget it. I feel like I have no time, because I waste a lot of it. Procrastinating. It is ruining my life. The only good thing is it keeps my hunger at bay, and my weight is at 120. I think I am taking more and more to keep awake during the day. What is so wonderful, your doc gives you this stuff, and no one tells you to watch for side effects. I wonder if I was off all these meds how I would be. I am 41 and feel like a 90 year old taking a bunch of pills each day. One to bring me up, one to bring me down, one for depression one for anxiety. I have never been one to lose patience, and I lose it all the time. I have ruined relationships because of it. I react, don't think.  I feel like I need rehab.

I have a lot more patience for my son and I feel better in general.  I think people should however be very careful with this medication and take it very carefully. So yes this drug can be used for bad. If not taken the right way. But for people like me its the answer to my problems.

column1: 2058$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/8/2009 6:00:46 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$3$"I started taking Adderall XR a year ago

column7: 110 pounds).

column1: During these hours

column4: I just daydream and can't stand sitting there for more than 1.5 hours.  Now

column8: when I am on it

column1: Side effects: dry mouth
column2: my old O.C.D. tendencies spring up
column3: I do not eat (I lose weight during the part of the week that I take it)
column4: I smoke cigarettes (I recently quit and never desire one
column5: but when I take adderall
column6: I smoke a lot)

column1: I do notice that I build a tolerance to it whenever I take it like three days in a row.  It doesn't last as long.
Basically
column2: during those 6 hours
column3: all I want to do is study.  I'd imagine that if I took it on a day where I had no studying/class
column4: I'd probably go NUTS.  I guess because I am normally focused in everything else
column5: just not in schoolwork.

column1: It has definitely helped me (my GPA is now 3.6
column2: compared to 2.0 before taking it) and I do not crave it on the days that I don't take it. However
column3: I can definitely see how detrimental the side affects of this drug can be
column4: and I'm so glad I only have one more year of school left!"

column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years$5$5$4$I am a successful nationally known professional advertising photographer who was on Adderall for about five years and then decided that I did not need it anymore because all of my old ADHD habits where mostly gone. I was off of them for about three months and all of those long gone adhd habits that had played havoc with my life started coming back one by one. Unpaid parking tickets
column3: loosing my keys
column4: rash decisions
column5: unfinished project after unfinished project. Within six months I had almost lost my photography business that I had worked so hard for and had collections agencies after me etc.  Wow what a bust to my ego! I guess I really do need to be on Adderall. It's as if when I am not on Adderall I know exactly what it is I need to do to keep my life running smooth...I put together my to do list but the to do list never gets completed. Yes I am a successful advertising photographer with lots of talent...but without the discipline and focus to apply that talent my world falls apart. I guess I just need to take it...it is what it is. I know there are lots of talented artists who take adderall...and I do not feel it makes me any less creative....or for that matter any more creative. How one little adderall XR pill makes the difference between being reasonably disciplined and totally irresponsible
column6: however
column7: is beyond me...but for me the reality is just that. I am now back on Adderall 20 MG XR and things are going great again. Hope this was helpful to any other artists out there who are struggling with the to medicate/not to medicate question. In my case the choice was made for me...I do not even think I would still be in business without this drug..no kidding.

column1: 2081$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/27/2008 10:18:49 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$I have had ADHD
column2: most likely since I was a young kid (I'm now 24)
column3: but diagnosed a little over 1 year ago.  I recently finished graduate school
column4: and stopped the Adderall since I stopped seeing the MD.  Now that I've been back on it (about 2 weeks) I'm much more focused
column5: I don't drift off when I'm speaking to clients and feel more motivated to finish my work on time.  I'm also  not binging as often as I used to
column6: which is extremely helpful since I have gained 10 pounds in the last 6 months.  I don't feel aggressive or angry to the point where its affecting my life and hurting others.  Of course
column7: I still have to make some behavioral changes to improve my organizational skills
column8: but that's not something any medication can fix.  Don't expect it to change everything
column9: as part of the treatment for ADHD is to learn new tools to combat the symptoms.  This medication is not a good idea if you or any family members have a history of substance abuse or dependence
column10: since you are predisposed to those conditions.  If you have any psychiatric issues in addition to the ADHD
column11: you must speak with your doctor about them
column12: since treatment will be counterproductive.  You play the greatest role in your treatment-not the medication.

column1: 2097$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/30/2008 9:30:38 PM$Reviewer: [emailÂ protected]
column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$4$"I began taking adderall at 15mg when I was in the 4th grade (2001-2002) I lost about 28 pounds almost immediatly which was not a bad thing because I was about 30 pounds over weight. My doctor moved me down to 12 mg to stop the weight lose
column3: which it did. I did however notice that it was not working as well so I was placed back onto 15 mg. The 15 mg dosage no longer worked as well as it originally did so I was bumped up to 20 mg and than once again to 25mg and in the 8th grade I was finally bumped up to 30mg where I remain to this day in the 11th grade.

column1: Side effects I have experienced:
Lose of Weight
Lose of Apetite
Depression
O.C.D symptoms (extermely prevelent in my last two years)
Anxiety
Paranoia
P.T.S.D

It is strange I go through a living hell almost day by day which may or may not be because of the Adderall but I can not just stop taking it because I fear being the way I am when I'm off of it during my everyday life because I get really ""crazy"" when I am not on it and eat a lot and just am moody and its pretty bad so I stay on it even though sometimes (more than less) I feel like a am losing my mind. I sometimes wonder what I would be like today if 8 years ago I had not been put on Adderall. (I actually did not have ADHD in the beginning it was ADD but it seemed to have developed into ADHD.)"

column1: 2109$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/10/2008 1:21:14 AM$Reviewer: dominoK
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"I am a 48 y.o university professor
column3: - after years of frustration and depression because of my procrastination habits and
column4: as I described it
column5: a lack of engagement between my brain and my body. I finally went into therapy just over a year ago at the urging of my wife and was diagnosed with ADHD. I started taking Adderall about 8 months ago. I have found that Adderall is very effective at helping me to focus and listen. It helps me to be more deliberate in my actions
column6: I'm not just drifting through the day. In my classroom I have found that I am able to listen to myself better and not be distracted by those students who give me that 'I'm so bored' look. One of the most interesting effects I've found is that I now actually hear and listen to the lyrics of songs! - never did that before. Looking back at my life
column7: all the way to when I was 6 years old I now recognize the symptoms that had always been there.  I feel that the treatment is working for me
column8: but as my doctor says
column9: the worst part is that I'm 48 and have only now finally taken care of a life-long problem. I take 30 mg. (15 mg standard 2 x a day). I did feel the side effects for about the first two or three days (teeth grinding and dry mouth) but they subsided and I don't have any issues with that now. I've lost a few pounds
column10: but I love to eat and  once I start eating
column11: my appetite is fine. I know that I'll have to continue with this
column12: probably for the rest of my life
column13: but I think of it as a simple compound that my body chemistry is simply missing - so it helps me a lot.

column1: Finally I would say to those of you suffering horrible side effects
column2: stop
column3: and get another opinion! If the side effects are that bad
column4: then you probably have a different problem. Amphetamines are an important drug that can work well for those who need it
column5: but if you don't
column6: you are abusing it. I thought that it would be like the speed we experimented with in high school
column7: but it's not. It is an essential part of my life now
column8: stigma or not -"

column1: 2117$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/1/2008 2:56:40 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$3$5$"I've been taking Adderall for the past 3 months. I switched over from Focalin because that drug did little to improve my ADD; it just made me irritable once it wore off. I'm on 30 mg twice a day now. The drug puts me in a good place but it doesn't seem to accomplish its actual purpose. I know I've become dependent on it even in this short period of time. Other users have noted this drug should be avoided if you have an addictive personality. I agree completely. It never occured to me that I might have ADD
column2: I was more concerned about my depression. Anyways
column3: my psych noted that I consume about three caffinated drinks a day along with a pack and a half of cigarettes. Now this drug is just another one of the stimulants I consume throughout the day to feel normal
column4: or at least like what I have come to consider ""normal."" Seriously
column5: I've met herion addicts who expressed concern when I told them I take Adderall. This drug is dangerous. Part of me thinks the companies behind it are guilty of endangering a lot of people
column6: but when I remember how I felt just after a few days of being off it
column7: you won't see me trying to stop them."

column1: 2118$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/27/2008 5:21:59 PM$Reviewer: DevinT
column2: 19-24 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$3$4$"In high school
column3: my mom kept on me to do my schoolwork
column4: which was good.  However
column5: half way through college
column6: I started failing classes not having support
column7: so I went to the school counselor.

column1: She helped me out a bit with a schedule
column2: but still in crunch time
column3: halfway through a Term (quarter)
column4: I just couldn't focus for homework.  She brought up ADD
column5: so I contacted a Psychiatrist.

column1: My psychiatrist wasn't there
column2: so I had my initial assessment with a stand in.  She said I probably have Bipolar II (hypomanic-depressive).  Shocked
column3: I still geared up and looked up symptoms and this and that.  Sure
column4: so I have mild/moderate Bipolar...I thought everyone did.

column1: I had an appointment with my real psychiatrist
column2: and he was on the edge on if I was Bipolar or ADD.  Apparently
column3: a lot of the symptoms overlap.  It was possible I have both
column4: though
column5: so I scheduled another appointment and took Lamictal for BP2.

column1: The appointment after that was halfway through the term.  The mood swings were better
column2: but I still couldn't focus.  I was ""driven to distraction"" as he put it.  I would procrastinate to the point where I was not confident I could get the work done
column3: and then to cheer myself up
column4: I would do the very thing that I used to procrastinate (like a video game).

column1: He prescribed me this stuff
column2: Amphetamine Salts.  I took it the day after he prescribed it...and for good reason.  I had an assignment due the next morning.  I had a meeting to prepare for and run.  I had important people to email.

column1: It felt like I was sipping on a heavily caffeinated beverage all day.  That's when I'm most motivated.  I got all the emails sent out
column2: I ran the meeting just fine
column3: and I edited 8 pages of a document that I have been sitting on for over a year.

column1: The side effects I experienced were dry mouth
column2: muscle tension
column3: strange busts of tiredness that go away in 10 minutes
column4: high blood pressure (expected)
column5: feeling a little cold
column6: easy smiling
column7: and restlessness.

column1: It's been 3 days.  I actually WANT to do work now.  So weird..."
2119$Condition: Other$9/25/2008 7:13:23 PM$Reviewer: Success from St. Louis
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$4$"I have been taking Adderall for six years now and what a difference it has made in my life.  I was finally diagnosed w/ADD when I was 20.  All my life I STRUGGLED through school (constantly daydreaming
column3: forgetting assignments
column4: awful  comprehension). I studied so hard and still earned mostly Cs. Teachers suggested to my parents that I be tested for ADD but I refused because I thought it meant I was dumb.  When I went away to college I did not have my parents reminding me to study or do homework.  The work load and subject matter was increasingly more difficult until one semester I ended up with a 1.5 GPA.  At that point I had enough of the struggle and I made an appointment with my Doctor.  After going through testing I was diagnosed with ADD and was put on Adderall.  I suddenly started to really enjoy school and on top of it all
column5: I really wasn't dumb.  I ended that semester with a 3.85 GPA.  I got an A in Quantitative Business Statistics and loved the class. I continued on with excellent grades and enjoying school and graduated from a State University with a Bachelor of Science.  My only regret is not starting this treatment sooner.  I think that years of struggling through school
column6: feeling left behind
column7: and feeling ""stupid"" has a negative impact on a child's development of self confidence
column8: self esteem
column9: and perseverance in life. For people that are ""on the fence"" about taking medication or allowing their child to take meds to treat truly DIAGNOSED ADD/ADHD
column10: ask yourself this..... If(you/your child) had diabetes would you not give your(self/child) insulin?  Everyone should have all the tools they need to succeed.  I am thrilled to be succeeding in life!!"

2140$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/5/2008 5:41:41 PM$Reviewer: dd
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$2$5$I am a mental health therapist
column3: and reading these reviews of Adderall makes me want to laugh and cry at the same time.  I am also taking adderall
column4: and know in my heart that I am addicted
column5: and struggle with knowing this everyday.  With not wanting to refill my script
column6: but knowing that the addict in me will call my doctor and get a refill.  Knowing that I will become emotionless and cold
column7: sleepless and edgy
column8: but with a clean house and unhappy children who don't understand why their mom is so tense and angry.  I know that I will start having to take Zanax and Ambien to calm down at night
column9: and that the divide between my husband and I will grow bigger.  This medication helped me at first
column10: it felt like legal meth.  Because that is what it is.  The sad thing is
column11: I was working in the substance abuse field when I began by adderall journey.  I am not saying that everyone will experience what I am going through
column12: but my sister also has the exact same problems.  While I thought we would be having cookouts and taking our kids to the park
column13: instead we are swapping scripts and pills and cleaning tips.  I caution everyone who is thinking about taking this drug to consider whether they can do it responsibly
column14: and their family history of addiction.  Reading these other reviews makes me feel much less alone
column15: but also very sad that so many people are having these problems.  I realize that I may need help to get off of it
column16: but that is very hard when you work in the field that I do and your professional reputation is on the line.  I use up my script in less than two weeks
column17: and then have two weeks without it.  The two weeks w/out it are so much better
column18: but the addict in me never listens.  Every month I think I can do it responsibly.  I just wonder
column19: when is it gonna be to much?  I know the saying one is to many and a thousand is never enough.  In my case
column20: that is so true.  Please be careful.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$2$1$"I have been switching between Adderall XR and Adderall non-time released for about 3 years. Right now I take 90 milligrams a day of Adderall non-time released. I have days where I am tired
column3: on these days I take more than perscribed. In my opinion Adderall is highly ""abusive"". When you take a medication long enough your body becomes immune and the medication isnt as effective as it was when you first started taking it.

column1: I dont think Adderall should be prescribed to children under the age of 18. All it takes is a simple 20 question evaluation and you are prescribed a drug that may forever change your life.

I have faith in God that He will get me through this and allow me to feel again. The Will of God will never take you where the grace of God cannot protect you. God bless you all!!

column1:
2151$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/14/2008 1:47:08 AM$Reviewer: Truth (Patient) $3$2$2$I believe I have a mix of hyperactivity and inattentivness.. I'm easily distracted, like to be on the move (as if driven by a motor), its hard to stay on task, I zone-out/daydream here & there, I find it hard to be motivated, especially in school (unless I am genuinely interested in the material & feel it really applies to my life). I procrastinate, can be quite disorganized, and stress out because of this all! Thats when I dont take Adderall.  Only somewhat effective because the tablets tend to wear off as the day progresses which results in irritability, they initially get me down to business. I'd hoped that side-effecrs wouldnt apply to be but well in reality they do. this drug really is no joke and should be taken seriously because of its habit-forming tendency. i dont like the idea of depending on a substance to do things i used to be able to do without it. true, those things were harder to do before Adderall, but: when i would go a day or 2 without it, or just be on a lower dose, i found that the fatigue that set in as a result (side-effect) made those things harder than it had been before ever taking the Adderall! Essentially Adderall had picked me & dropped me lower than before =/ I don't want to go back off of it, however i do want my genuine self back, the one that isn't so serious and annoyed. high blood pressure is another thing to look out for. this can raise it. it makes me tense at times. But if you're like me you'll like it AT FIRST. It helps me work & i mean efficiently, but I don't always need this stuff.. maybe when i have a paper due but not when just hanging with friends. i made it without Adderall but it wasnt easy & it especially isnt now that i've been on it. Learning about ADD helps me understand myself better & discover under what conditions i'm best able to work. this'll make a difference in whether I decide to continue it. I of course respect that the severity of the ADD in any case also must be addressed. Dosage is also very important.
2152$Condition: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day$7/11/2008 2:59:08 AM$Reviewer: wetwonderland, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I suffer from chronic fatigue.  After trying several different meds, this one is the only one that has made a difference in my ability to wake up and get going.  A big difference.  I take 40 mgs when I get up and sometimes another 20 in the afternoon.  It has made my life so much better.  It is not perfect, but I'd rather take it than feel like I did before.  When my new Dr. said she wouldn't be able to prescribe it, I cried.  My quality of life was at stake.  I changed doctors.

2154$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/26/2008 6:00:49 PM$Reviewer: CollegeStudent, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$3$4$I am a 23 year old college student.  I started taking adderall to help me with my school work about 7 months ago.  Before the medicine I procrastinated
column2: could not finish a projects
column3: was disinterested
column4: and unmotivated.  When I take this medication I shed all of those characteristics. I am able to study for about 5-8 hours straight and obtain all the information. I am in my senior year of college and thought I could use a push to finish the hard classes. I became interested in learning; I grasped concepts easily
column5: and became level headed and rational.  I will say though
column6: there is a huge downside.  I got bad headaches
column7: lost ten pounds
column8: blacked out frequently for a second when I stood up
column9: chest pains
column10: and numbness in my hands. When on the medication
column11: I lost my connection to emotion and was very irritable.  I tended to be cold and distant.  I know this medicine works but I did not want to put my body through the side effects any longer.

column1: I have stopped taking this due to the person I was becoming.  It takes more discipline for me to study and stay focused but at least I feel like my true self.
This drug is habit forming. I thought I could not get an A on a test without it
column2: but I did and I can.  Plus now when I get an A it is more rewarding knowing it was all me who earned
column3: not the adderall.

column1:
2155$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/26/2008 12:54:20 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$1$2$Freshman yr of college i was diagnosed with ADD, the Inattentive kind. My experience with Adderall has been a love/hate relationship. I started on 20mg in a.m. & 10mg in p.m. It gave me more energy, made me mentally sharper & I felt normal & happier since I was more able to communicate & think clearly. I was happy.. at first. Then I noticed I could stay up WAY late. Then I'd sleep in & miss the classes I'd finally begun thoroughly doing the work for. Also, friends pointed out Id become irritable & mean at times. I agreed but was upset because of all the good adderall was doing for me otherwise. The tablets wore off later in the day, causing my moods. My prescriber recommended a higher dose, I agreed & I liked it, I was focused on getting my stuff done. STILL, I was.. cold, emotions were distant. IMPORTANT: check before you start this if theres a history of addictions to substances like alchohol etc in your family as this can really be HABIT-FORMING, as in my case. Also, Adderall doesnt allow refills. This was prob when back from out of state college & I had insurance- coverage issues, which forced me to go off adderall. DIFFICULT. I was SO tired, moreso than EVER before. felt like a moody addict & sad & like doing NOTHING.2nd day with no Adderall in my system, woke up during the night & threw up. Horrible & bizarre. BE CAREFUL, listen to your body's signs if on it. Try keeping lowest dose possible. Off adderall, I still had a job to get & chores ETC when just functioning was a task. Gained back the weight i'd lost, plus a few. After that I felt better each day, but back to my spacey, scattered & anxious self again. Caffiene helped, in big amts. Insurance is fixed, I caved & am back on it. They say you'll feel like a different person. Maybe, I feel my old Adderall self returning, more focused but mean. My family has noticed. Mom said i'm not my old self. & I fear I'm becoming dependent again. Im taking lower doses & may switch to Dexedrine or Adderall XR. Think.     
2156$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/23/2008 11:10:43 AM$Reviewer: Spinnin, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$3$2$I have been on adderall (20mg) for about 5 years. column5: but I had that before I ever took Adderall. This is like a miracle drug for me. Now if only I knew a doc who would give me enough to last all month.

column1: 2176$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/6/2008 6:26:16 PM$Reviewer: brett
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$1$5$"I'm 20 and in my first year of college. I was diagnosed with ADD in 6th Grade for my lack of ability to concentrate
column3: I was/am quite the day dreamer. The Doc put me on 5mg Adderall XR I believe. My freshman year the dose was increased to 10mg. At the time I didn't know fully how it effected me
column4: all I knew is that it made me want to throw desks at the teachers that irritated me
column5: and that I was unhappy and pissed of for no reason. I switched from adderall to stratera
column6: then to ritali LA
column7: but I prefered not taking anything because of how they effected me. In January I started back on Adderal XR @ 15mg and I told myself that it's worth the sacrifice to have good grades and be able to focus
column8: but I  now that I am older I am more aware of how it effects me. My grades immediately went from C's to high B's and the Highest gpa I've had in years. I quit taking it when I realized that it was destroying my life in the following ways:

column1: -Extreme OCD behavior
-Depression
-AntiSocial behavior
-Muscular twitches
-Dependence
-Most of all
column2: Loss of identity

column1: Naturally I am a outgoing person
column2: I love people
column3: I'm easy going
column4: and always have a smile on my face but Adderall flipped my world upside down. I would not recommend any parent putting their child on this medication under any circumstance
column5: if you care about them at all. ADD is not a disorder
column6: it is just a way to classify people who function on a higher/different level than the average population. ADD is a gift that our society hasn't learned how to handle.

column1: My recommendation to parents would be to look for and encourage the abilities and gifts your child has
column2: and be as supportive as you possibly can. They need to know that they are brilliant
column3: creative
column4: and gifted. The reason ADD'ers can't focus well is because they are constantly thinking! What kind of world do we live in when thinking needs to be medicated?!"

2180$Condition: Other$4/28/2008 1:39:04 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$5$I first saw a doctor when I was 17 yrs. old seeking treatment for depression and constant lethargy. However
column2: after answering a short questionnaire
column3: I was diagnosed with ADD
column4: and have been on Adderall (which was helpful at first) ever since. Now
column5: I've been on the medication so long that I can't remember who
column6: or how I was before I started taking it. In addition to causing my mild OCD to become full blown routine-altering OCD
column7: I find that the medication increases my irritability 10 fold (especially when it's wearing off
column8: and especially within the last year). I'm not sure if it is the medication or simply life circumstances that is now causing me severe depression
column9: extreme lack of motivation
column10: and weird and very sudden mood swings. I have also experienced more common side effects
column11: like jaw clenching
column12: tension
column13: dizziness
column14: and increased heart rate. I would like to try to stop taking the medication now
column15: but feel I am dependent on it and am afraid of the withdrawal effects. I worry about the long term side effects that I may experience from taking this drug for so long
column16: and the misery that it may/may not be causing me presently. I would NEVER consider putting a child on this medication.

column1: 2181$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/27/2008 3:04:38 PM$Reviewer: Cat-mom
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$4$"I have taken a low dose of adderall for about five years
column3: and it has changed my life.

column1: My ability to think ahead
column2: anticipate and avoid problems has dramatically improved. My abilty to articulate myself improves dramatically on adderal â especially with a low dose.  I can understand the consequences of my actions with a clarity that I wish I had earlier in life J My over-all attention span has dramatically improved in the last five years â and it remains significantly higher even on days when I choose not to take adderall. To me
column3: that is amazing. Tasks I once found painful
column4: I can now do quickly an efficiently with patience and perfect detail â even off adderall. A large part of why I think I see a lot of improvement is not just the medication
column5: but also all the other things I do to combat ADHD.

column1: When I need to learn something new (e.g. a software program at work) adderal helps me quickly learn and absorb the new information
column2: and remember facts. It is a dramatic change from my past abilities.

column1: When I first started taking the drug
column2: I had heart palpitations. It is definitely hard on the heart. BUT then I started to add regular
column3: gentle but rigorous aerobic exercise to my routine (which
column4: btw
column5: is a non-prescription treatment for ADHD)
column6: my heart became stronger
column7: more conditioned than before and the palpitations stopped. My resting hr is 45 bpm
column8: and my blood pressure is ideal
column9: or close to it. This also will solve any insomnia problems.

column1: I recommend this drug â FOR THE RIGHT PERSON. Fact is we are all built differently. Which is the whole reason why drugs like this are made in the first place. Depending on your peculiarities
column2: it may not give you exactly what you need.  That doesnât mean this drug wonât be very helpful to someone else. I look forward to the day when these types of drugs can be prescribed and monitored more accurately. "
