column1: 2183$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/21/2008 11:26:17 AM$Reviewer: c_jernigan, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$1$5$My initial response to Adderall XR was great - it changed my life
column2: but then ... and there is always a ""but"" in life - the effects began to wear off and then I think that Adderall began muting my endocrine system.  In a nutshell - it significantly reduced my level of perceived anxiety. I didn't realize it
column3: but I was probably living with a ""4"" on a 1 - 10 scale for general anxiety.  Adderall brought me down to a 1 or 2.  I think that basically after a month or two my adrenaline and other things were basically either all used up
column4: or the receptor sites were burned out.  Basically there was no ""fire"" because all of the fuel had been burned up.  Also
column5: I think that I had some mild depression creeping in - I became somewhat unmotivated
column6: and really didn't want to do much physically.

column1: After about 1 year my libido dropped like a rock
column2: my testicles felt as if they had shrunken to 1/2 their normal size.  My body temperature was always low - it was routinely in the mid 96 to low 97 range.  I had no physical strength nor endurance - where I had been previously in good shape and could crank out 25 pushups at any given time
column3: I could only manage 20 or so ""girl"" pushups (supported by knees) after which time I was exhausted.  After working out
column4: I didn't feel as if I was gaining any benefit or very minor benefit
column5: almost as if I was having a muted recovery.

column1: After initially becoming more organized I began slipping back
column2: then I was maybe only 25% of my initial organization.

column1: I have stopped taking XR on a daily basis and have begun taking it only ""as needed"" - what my doctor doesn't know will not hurt him.  I think that something needs to be recharged - I am now an advocate of ""drug holidays""
column2: every other day usage
column3: or simply ""as needed"" be that at work
column4: or home.

column1: I never found myself feeling mentally addicted - but I did have brain fog for a couple of days when stepping down.
I was on 30mg/day Adderall XR - 40yo male - ~18 months.

2184$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/16/2008 7:26:13 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking the XR 20mg a day for about 6 months now and it has completely changed my life. You would have never known I had an attention problem because I was a very active teenager.  I was involved in sports, many extracuricular activities and worked since I was 16 so my mind was constantly focused on something different.  It became a problem after becoming a single mom.  I couldn't organize any thought.  If there was too much going on I couldn't focus to organize it.  I didn't pay bills, I took extreme chances, and even forgot I was a mom sometimes.  After finally confessing to my mother how i felt she suggested talking to my PCP.  He gave me the 20mg XR 6 months ago and now I feel as though I am actually living my life.  I have since fixed my finances, gotten promoted at work, and enjoy my time with my daughter so much more.  I would suggest this treament to anyone as long as their Dr. agrees.  Use caution when taking this it can be very addicting, and should not for children that have no gone through puberty.  i have lost 30 pounds since start because of the lack of appetite and amount of exercise i do.  I also have about two nights a week that i have trouble falling asleep.  over all I thank myself every day for being able to communicate how I felt.  I am finally the person I always wanted to be and never thought could be.

column1: 2202$Condition: Other$2/29/2008 1:42:29 AM$Reviewer: Miss Bonner
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$"I have been diagnosed with bipolar disorder along with PTSD since I was thirteen. I am now 25

column1: During the first day of two 30mg. tablets I did fine
column2: with the exception of a few jitters.  I wasn't sleepy or depressed as usual.  After consulting my doctor
column3: he said it was a sign that I should double my dosage.  Then came the second and third days.  I was a maniac!  I would sit for hours preforming illogical tasks that I couldn't stop; like combing my hair for 6 hours.  My eyes were dialated
column4: I ached from being tense
column5: and I also felt disconnected from the world.  I was very irritable
column6: paranoid
column7: dizzy
column8: sweating
column9: short of breath
column10: and OCD.  I couldn't fall asleep without prescription medications.  I was too anxious to even take the trash out.  I will never take stimulants of this kind again.  Afterall
column11: I know I am bipolor

column1: 2203$Condition: Other$2/27/2008 1:16:48 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $2$2$1$"I was prescribed adderall for ADD without hyperactivity 15mg 2x a day. column2: tightness in my chest
column3: labored breathing
column4: jaw pain/teeth clenching
column5: headaches
column6: dizziness

I will be fine taking it if I havent had it in a few days but the come down is so terrible that I am unable to sleep properly for the next 2 days and experience a hangover so terrible that I am unable to take it again for at least 3 days. column1: As an adult
column2: my hyperactivity DECREASED

column1: Her concern is my age. Phys health is GOOD: no heart
column2: liver
column3: kidney
column4: lung problems. Low BP all my life. Never smoked
column5: rarely drink maybe glass of wine once a month. XR is slow-starting
column6: so mornings are shot before I know it
column7: then have severe sleepy period in mid-aft. XR kicks in again around 5PM but then I hyperfocus on all the wrong things until 10-11PM
column8: when I binge & fidget until I go to sleep with xanax around 1AM.

column1: Here is my personal dx: I'm under-dosed. On Adderall XR
column2: a minimum 60mg x 2 plus 10mg D-amp x 2.

column1: Preference is Dex Spans + 5mg Dex tabs x 3.
XR's inconsistent & a rollercoaster ride."

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$3$4$I am a 23 year old recent college graduate that has been taking Adderall Oral for the past 6 to 7 months.  I was not diagnosed with ADD/ADHD until the start of my treatment.  With this treatment I have noted some very distinct changes in my performance in college and now in my career.  I am a Mechanical Engineer in NC.  My focus at work seems to be increased but not over the top.  I finally feel that I can start a project and follow it through to the end.  Finishing the minute details that have plagued me in the past and that I have procrastinated with in the past.  I feel that Adderall oral is an effective treatment for my condition.  Although I strongly urge parents and students to take caution with using this treatment option.  I have noticed a weekly to bi-weekly occurrence of limited sleep for one to two nights.  This seems to typically happen on a Friday night and Sunday nights.  As this has continued I feel that there are some other treatments that I should attempt before settling on this one.  Also as I was diagnosed during my final semester of college with ADD/ADHD I noticed that I suddenly had more friends then the prior 5 years of college.  So parents
column3: students in college with go to extreme measures to acquire Adderall from your child. This is also becoming an increasing concern for college campuses across the nation.  Like I said before
column4: I believe
column5: this medication should be taken consistently and you shouldn't miss many treatments.  Missing treatments has made me extremely groggy and lazy.  So caution to not taking it on the weekends.  I have noticed that when I continued treatment for 7 days a week I didn't have the haze
column6: groggy and lazy feeling.  Also I reduce my dosage to half during the weekends. I hope this helps all in some manner.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I took this medication because of my ADD problems in high school. My doctor originally started me off with a drug that is almost exactly Ritalin. I started with it in freshman year due to my lowly grades and noticeable problems. I started using the ritalin like drug
column3: but saw no satisfying results. It also seemed to be correlated with having sleeping problems
column4: appetite loss
column5: and depression. So i stopped using it. When i went to my doctor and told him about  it he seemed to realize that the ritalin wasn't causing the stress and other problems
column6: but it was just the the troubles of freshman year. The drug and my problems weren't actually connected. My doctor prescribed adderall for me in my sophomore year
column7: and i almost instantaneously saw the improvements
column8: faster reaction time
column9: less daydreaming
column10: and i could keep my grades up and remember my work with ease. Luckily i had parents that trusted me enough to let me keep the medication in my own place(in my room) because i was ashamed at first to have to take something to make myself better. It was as if it kind of lifted a disability completely off of my shoulders. Ive taken it all the way through college and stopped when i graduated
column11: i experienced no real withdrawal
column12: I just had to make a smooth transition which my doctor helped me with greatly. If taken in the right doses and not obsessed about it seems to be a very good help for my future and self esteem.

column1: Just realize that what you see as depression and other related things could very well be the much more stressful and much more dangerous thing called high school."

There are a few complications with it if you take 40 mg or higher for a long period of time (i.e-years) i have read that there is a possiblity of heart complications. column1: 2273$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/2/2007 11:36:27 AM$Reviewer: Persimmon
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$3$2$"This drug seems less harsh than ritalin
column3: but it still causes a down feeling as it wears off. Nonetheless
column4: - perhaps 50%+ of the time Adderall has been quite helpful in getting me in focus and on track.That is a great benefit because I find myself restlessly pacing much of the time and unable to initiate or complete projects
column5: Often I have felt too defeated to even hoppe to begin a project. I have lived with thisa painful condition for 20 years or more.

column1: When I do dfocus i can becaome very effective and creative. It has been a strained interior battle to find ways to establish a balance and a rhythm in daily life.
I also take the antidepressant Cymbalta and often I also need to take Artivan.
So
column2: it is a frustrating story. Adderall is a great help when it helps
column3: and yet i worry about dependence and also the apparent habituation.

column1: All medications for mood and behavior seem to offer complicated trade-offs requiring frequent self-evaluation and consultation with doctors and also with friends and family. Often I feel embarrassed that I seem to need these types of medicines
column2: and yet is  clear that for me they are helpful and also

column1: problematic."

column1: 2279$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/28/2007 7:11:52 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"I've been on Adderall on & off over the past few years (off because of pregnancy/nursing). column4: but at least now I can keep up with my responsibilities enough that I even have time to eat!"

column1: 2282$Condition: Other$11/27/2007 6:05:57 PM$Reviewer: $4$3$5$The main problem with Adderall is that it is extremely addictive. I started taking it to help me get through classes and work. I loved that it killed my appetite. I thought I'd be able to take it in moderation
column2: but I take it everyday now. I just feel like a happier person when I take it. But I've noticed that I am distant and easily annoyed if I take too much. Sometimes I feel that I'm on the verge of having a panic attack. If I take 15 MG a day and I eat I feel amazing. But its very easy to avoid eating and take 30 MG because you just get so much done. Im very nervous that I will become strongly addicted to the drug. Im also nervous that I will loose too much weight. Scary.

column1: 2283$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/24/2007 4:50:54 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$
2284$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/23/2007 11:28:26 AM$Reviewer: Robert K
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Adderall has worked very well for me. My thought process is much more organized and my ability to stay focused on a conversation and tuned into the subject at hand has improved immensely.  I have over the years tried to slow and constrain my hyperactivity with lorasapam and other sedatives with only a moderate amount of success; major side effect was drossiness and fatigue. I looked into the possibilities of Adderall after speaking with a coworker who was prescribed Adderall several years ago and how he was able to continue his education due to his ability effectively concentrate.  After reading more about the symptoms associated with ADD it seemed to be a perfect match to my condition. This medication has reduced much of my public speaking inhibition; I find that I am more out going
column3: in control
column4: less critical of my self
column5: and more inclined to participate in meeting and activities with minimum anxiety. My sexual drive is actually more enhanced. I am taking 5mg three times daily
column6: but am still adjusting the dosage to alleviate side effects (inability to fall asleep at night) and achieve the maximum benefit. This has been an extremely positive life changing treatment for ADD.

column3: my world was finally coming together. I quit taking it when i found out i was pregnant
column4: i had no withdraw symtoms
column5: the only thing i notice was the add symptoms were back in full affect
column6: it was a long yr and half. I went back on them about a little over yr ago and things are back to normal again. im so glad i finally got treatment
column7: i just wish i would of done it sooner.

column1: 2287$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/18/2007 12:29:14 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$This drug has been a life saver for me. Addy helps me slow down and focus my brain enough to acutally complete the tasks I need to and to do it efficiently. Of course
column2: in the beginning
column3: I got a few side effects - dry mouth
column4: appetite loss
column5: diarrhea (dont take with coffee - TRUST ME)
column6: and some insomnia. I also found myself craving cigarettes for some odd reason. I found that if I ate a meal before taking it in the morning that it almost eliminated most of them. After a few months your body will get used to it. I DO recommend that if you don't need it on the weekends that you don't take it. That way
column7: your body won't be as likely to get addicted to it. I've been taking it for 4 years and I LOVE IT.

column1: 2288$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/18/2007 1:57:33 AM$Reviewer: newguy
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I have always been successful in life
column3: but at extreme measures (which I thought were normal).  After finding out my older brother had ADHD I started looking into it. What I found was I was a dead on case. So it's been 2 weeks on Adderal and it has made my life easier on every level. Keep in mind it is a stimulant so follow the dose and be true to yourself and talk with your doctor about your reactions on the drug.  Sleep and appetite our at times and issue
column4: but remember to eat frequently and don't take adderall near bed-time. The positives far out weigh anything else. You can actually go thru life and take things as they come.  It doesn't have to feel like you against the world when facing tasks
column5: challenges etc.  A+ for this...

column1: 2289$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/16/2007 9:08:49 AM$Reviewer: kilacalli
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$After trying a few different similar drugs I found that this worked best. With others I lost weight and felt sickly 24/7 (sick to my stomach
column3: weak
column4: lightheaded
column5: dry mouth
column6: just generally terrible). I started taking Adderall
column7: initially in a VERY small dose and I noticed significant improvement. My doctor and I played with the dosage and I'm so happy with the result. The ONLY set back is feeling jittery every now and again. The best solution for that is just to make sure you're eating an appropriate amount. Not tons
column8: but just spread out small meals and snacks and this won't pose a problem. Eating this way is way more healthy anyways. So now I can focus and feel very optimistic about getting things done everyday instead of dreading everything and having no energy
column9: will or attention to finish things (school work). Great drug. I was very nervous to start taking it because I normally refuse all medicine... but this REALLY helped. Just be careful with dosage and eating.

column1: 2358$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/23/2016 9:19:12 AM$Reviewer: aTroutDude
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"I am extremely happy with Evekeo. There are no roller coaster ups and downs that I had with Adderall
column3: a much smoother transition. The results/effect seem to last longer without the hyper-focus of Adderall.

column1: I was on Adderall and my VA doctor took me off it completely and said I didn't need it. I was getting in trouble at work for lack of attention to detail
column2: forgetting to pay bills
column3: etc. I went to another doctor
column4: she suggested I try Evekeo. The pharmacy through a communication error and had me on just one 10mg pill a day instead of three
column5: for 3 weeks. I had a follow up was put on three 10mg pills a day(2 @ 8a
column7: and allowed to play around with times taken and could go up to 4 a day. It was a completely experience from Adderall or the 10 mg Evekeo. Adderall was more like a light switch being flipped on then off as the medication wore off. Evekeo was a lot smoother
column8: I never really feel it kick in or turn off
column9: it is just kind of there. It is more like being more effective
column10: less effective. Even when the medication should have worn off
column11: I don't feel as scattered or spacey. With Adderall I would often get these episodes of hyper-focus where I had a hard time switching tasks. So far with Evekeo I have never had those episodes. I work retail
column12: and I am constantly changing focus from customers to task and back. I currently take three 10mg a day but the doctor wrote the script for 105. On longer days where I am up at 7a have to be to work at 1p and work until 9p. If I have taken one pill around 1 or 2p I can feel myself becoming less focused around 6-7p. If I take 2 around 1-2p it will last until around 8:30-9p
column13: which is perfect. I also found that I can't take it later than 3p
column14: I can't get to sleep before midnight-1a. Taking the last pill no later than 1:30p
column15: I can get to sleep by 11p."

column1: 2360$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/7/2015 12:54:46 AM$Reviewer: Spektur
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$3$3$"The physical side effects outweigh any of the mental benefits
column3: which pale in comparison to Dexedrine. Where do I begin
column4: evekeo makes me jittery
column5: anxious
column6: and feel just plain weird. I know what amphetamines should feel like
column7: when I heard 50% levo I pretty much knew what to expect but figured what the heck
column8: its only for a month.

column1: After having been on Dexedrine and adderall for the past 3 years
column2: and now Evekeo. I can fairly say that the levo side of amphetamines is not only inferior it also has far more side effects. This is somewhat of a known fact in the medical community. Amphetamines are either dexdro or levo or some of both. Dexdro tends to be more cerebral and calming while levo tends to be more physical and distruptive
column3: by distruptive I mean your heart will let you know pretty quickly.

column1: Dexedrine is 100% of the dexdro side of amphetamines
column2: Adderall is 75/25
column3: and Evekeo is 50/50. I know that everyone's treatment is personal
column4: so I'll speak for myself as only I can. Dexedrine is by far the superior product
column5: Adderall comes in second because it only has 25% levo.

column1: Evekeo lags behind with its whopping 50% of levo induced jitters
column2: palpitations and tweakiness. When my doc told my they have something new thats 50/50
column3: I was like
column4: you mean benzedrine
column5: yah thats not new. Kinda like when he tried to tout zenzedi as the new cool kid on the block
column6: I was like you mean rebranded dexadrine. I'll take my generic thanks.  I had my doubts about evekeo but wanted to give it a fair shot. Having had dexedrine before I know that there's way better treatment out there. "

column1: 2361$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/5/2015 11:16:11 PM$Reviewer: Moke
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$3$3$"After being on Adderall
column3: Vyvanse and Dexedrine Spansule
column4: I'd say Eveko is a highly effective dextro/levo amphetamine based drug. Unlike adderall
column5: this medication is very mild compared to adderall and the feeling of being wired. This medication lasts longer and more steady than adderall XR and the peak is much longer than Adderall IR. Compared to Vyvanse
column6: this medication has more of a steady in my system mildly vs Vyvanse being strong then wears off fast throughout the course of 12 hours.

column1: I wish they made this medication in higher doses than 5 and 10mg. It's the same thing as adderall except adderall is 75% Dextroamphetamine and 25% Levoamphetamine. This medication is freebase amphetamine sulfate so it's 50% Dextro/Levo. So a 10mg isn't much different than taking a 10mg adderall. It just releases it differently and freebase form is probably more potent than the salts. "

2369$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/19/2015 1:00:27 PM$Reviewer: ADHD21, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$2$2$I've been on Vyvanse for about 5 years now and could feel the effectiveness falling a little short each day. I switched over to Evekeo two months ago instead of upping my Vyvanse from 60mg to 70mg. It's effective in that it works in helping to maintain focus and it takes effect quickly. My primary problem is the mood it puts me in. I'm finding myself constantly irritable, stressed, and ready to lash out over, retrospectively, small annoyances. This is especially problematic on days where I leave my afternoon pill (it's a twice a day medication) at home. Two days ago, I was very surprised to find myself in a good mood with a generally positive outlook. Then I realized that I had not forgotten to take Evekeo that day. I'm dropping Evekeo with my next prescription and going back to Vyvanse. That being said, your experience might be different. There's a free month discount available, so it might be worth trying, but know that you might have to do some legwork to locate a pharmacy that carries it.

column2: but where it differs from everything I listed above
column3: it works wonders for getting out of bed.  Vyvanse takes up to an hour to kick in
column4: and Desoxyn/Dexedrine/Adderall was simply not strong enough or not the right 'type' of stimulant to actually propel me out of bed.  That said
column5: I work 12 hour days so when it comes to taking it when Vyvanse wears off it's subtle but has a nice peak that makes my 1.5 hour commute far safer
column6: and it wears off just a few hours after I get home.

column1: If the cost wasn't so ridiculous I'd go for this stuff
column2: but big pharma can stuff it because consumers are forced to use generics unless they are stupid
column3: rich
column4: or both.  Still
column5: probably the best IR stim out there."
